02e345e6-cef9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: North America meetup
02e345e6-cef9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from North America.

046787bd-49cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Predicting the future with the Google Cloud Platform
046787bd-49cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Can you predict the future using Big Data? Can you divine if your users will come back to your site or where the next social conflict will arise? And most importantly, can Brazil be defeated at soccer on their own turf? In this talk, we'll go through the process of data extraction, modelling and prediction as well as generating a live dashboard to visualize the results. We’ll demonstrate how you can use Google Cloud and Open Source technologies to make predictions about the biggest soccer matches in the world. You’ll see how to use Google BigQuery for data analytics and Monte Carlo simulations, as well as how to create machine learning models in R and pandas. We predict that after this talk you’ll have the necessary tools to cast your own eye on the future.

0486a8f4-4acb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making your cloud apps Google-fast
0486a8f4-4acb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: How do you make your cloud applications fast? For the past 15 years, Google have been developing tools and techniques for building fast cloud based services - something that we like to think of as ‘Google-Fast’.  In this session we’ll look at how we build Google Search, Google Maps and Gmail to be Google-Fast. We’ll demonstrate how you can apply much of what we’ve learned to building your own fast cloud services and applications using the tools and services available to you with Google Cloud Platform. We’ll provide deeper insight on how to get the best performance out of all of your cloud resources, from Persistent Disk performance to Cloud Datastore writes and beyond. You’ll leave this session fully equipped to design and build Google-Fast cloud applications on Google Cloud Platform.

0632a768-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Sourcegraph: A code search engine in Go
0632a768-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: SourceGraph is a code search and analytics engine that indexes the world of open source code. In this session we'll see how a small team used Go to build the service.

06853186-d0da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Deconstructing the user journey
06853186-d0da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: This workshop will introduce developers to a strategic user-centered process of understanding, visualizing and communicating complex interactions to reveal key behavioral insights at various touch points in their product or service. You will learn how to build empathy, create moments of delight, and remove roadblocks to provide users a more compelling and more valuable overall experience. Capacity: 100 people.

069b8d4a-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building a web app on App Engine
069b8d4a-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Get the most out of Google's Cloud Platform with Go, a productive, high-performance language for the cloud. This talk will cover the nuts and bolts of putting together an App Engine app in Go.

06e154b7-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building a web app on App Engine
06e154b7-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Get the most out of Google's Cloud Platform with Go, a productive, high-performance language for the cloud. This talk will cover the nuts and bolts of putting together an App Engine app in Go.

070b9c22-f0e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Distributing Native Code on the web using PNaCl
070b9c22-f0e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Are you a developer who wants to develop just one version of your application? Do you have an Android app using the NDK, but are struggling to find time to port all your C++ code to JavaScript for a web version? Come learn about how to use Portable Native Client to bring your native applications to the web. Hear case studies of Google Maps and IPython notebooks, and learn about the new tools we've brought to Native Client to make deployment a breeze.

0782b322-7bbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Material design: Motion
0782b322-7bbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Cross-platform motion design”

In this session, designers across Google discuss motion design in the material design approach, including key principles, transitions, and uses on newer platforms such as wearables.

078c6261-c7e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: NVIDIA tooling and performance
078c6261-c7e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The NVIDIA Developer Tools team will demonstrate how to optimize NDK Android applications with a comprehensive set of Graphics and CPU performance scenarios. This presentation will cover newly released tools for developers to take advantage of Tegra K1, with the Kepler GPU core, and demonstrate a variety of performance limited situations created with Croteam’s Serious Sam III game engine.

07fd8b0d-80bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Going global with Google Play
07fd8b0d-80bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Think your app or game has what it takes to become a global hit? Get key insights into major international markets and trends of successful apps and games in those regions. Leverage these pro tips and best practices to expand your game to a global audience.

09dad573-bbe6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: SDK tools for performance
09dad573-bbe6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

0bc7756d-d9d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Less code, more services, better Android apps
0bc7756d-d9d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
It doesn’t matter if you’re writing a multiplayer Android game, or a simple to-do app, your users are increasingly expanding multi-device access from anywhere.    However, sharing state from highscore lists to to-do lists between devices in a way that works well with spotty network connections is hard, error prone and expensive.   Wouldn’t it be great if Google took care of all that, while providing an easy path to expand as your app grows and matures?   

In this session, we will show you how to build mobile apps which use new Google technology to simplify data storage, online/offline behavior and synchronization across multiple devices. You’ll have full access to the data you store in the Google Cloud platform with app development features and the rich set of data analytics tools to get more use out of your data.   You’ll see how Android Studio tooling makes this straightforward, and allows you to bring the full power of Google Cloud Platform to your app as your needs grow. Come away equipped with new tools and skills to make your app better than ever, without writing hundreds of lines of code.

0c883b01-96e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: DevOps power tools
0c883b01-96e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: If you spend hours manually configuring your individual servers, you're doing it wrong. In this session, learn how to create repeatable environments, versioned configurations, and more productive engineers. Puppet, Chef, Salt, and Ansible are powerful tools to manage your infrastructure. We will show how to use these tools with Google Cloud Platform.

0f355a69-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: SDK tools for performance
0f355a69-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

11cfbbc5-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Large scale data processing in the Cloud
11cfbbc5-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Bring your own big data processing scenario, and let's see how Google's newest product for doing large scale data processing can help you clearly express and efficiently execute your pipeline.

12156c7f-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building App Engine with Gradle in Android Studio
12156c7f-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Now that App Engine is using Gradle in Android Studio, we'll go over how the gradle-appengine-plugin works and how to make it work for you.

1671e3d7-4ffd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Apps in school: Kids Panel
1671e3d7-4ffd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

1711357d-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Our favorite prototyping tools
1711357d-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Designers at Google demonstrate some of their favorite tools for prototyping UIs.

1a12e325-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android accessibility updates
1a12e325-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

1a228f62-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Android Studio startup station
1a228f62-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Android experts about how to setup your Android development environment using Android Studio and Gradle. Create your first project and run your Android app on an emulator or device. Capacity: 10 people.

1b6bdf54-96e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: DevOps power tools
1b6bdf54-96e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: If you spend hours manually configuring your individual servers, you're doing it wrong. In this session, learn how to create repeatable environments, versioned configurations, and more productive engineers. Puppet, Chef, Salt, and Ansible are powerful tools to manage your infrastructure. We will show how to use these tools with Google Cloud Platform.

1bb7dad4-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Introduction to Android accessibility
1bb7dad4-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

1d17ce38-bce6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android and cloud
1d17ce38-bce6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

1f39d646-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Meetup for Chinese speakers
1f39d646-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants who speak Chinese.

1f489c4f-f0e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Saving time and money with Google Wallet office hours
1f489c4f-f0e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Meet the Google Wallet team and learn how to build a great mobile commerce app.

1f74e581-5fbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Nest for developers
1f74e581-5fbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session, Nest will discuss its developer program, and how you can get involved.

1fdc255c-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Intel tooling and performance
1fdc255c-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Make your NDK app faster in real-time with performance optimization using Intel Graphics Performance Analyzers and Intel Vtune Amplifier. Intel's experts will be onsite, profiling real games and identifying performance opportunities.

20c8b164-cff9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: South America meetup
20c8b164-cff9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from South America.

22ce27dc-7cbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Who cares about new domain names? We do. If you want happy users, then you should too.
22ce27dc-7cbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The first new generic top-level domains are coming online, from .photography to .みんな. Who cares, you say? We do. We’ll tell you how the explosion of new domain names means cool things for the future of the web. But it isn’t all sunshine and rainbows. New domain names also creating unique challenges for developers. In fact, they may be impacting your products already. Join us to find out what’s happening, get a glimpse at what’s coming, and learn how to prepare.

22e6b6c0-c8b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Upgrading the engine mid-flight: How Google improves its web apps without downtime
22e6b6c0-c8b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Changing the implementation of a business-critical web app without any downtime or user interruptions can be nerve-racking. As software engineers, it's what we're asked to do every day. At Google, we know all about keeping our users happy and productive while swapping out low-level implementations. In this session, we share proven techniques for writing business-critical web applications, no matter the size of the app. Learn our lessons and successes while we migrate one of Google's largest web applications to the modern web and Dart, giving you concrete tips you can use in your next rewrite. Along the way, we'll share insights into Google's software development practices, team dynamics, and culture.

23f02a6c-70dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: The power tools of Chrome DevTools
23f02a6c-70dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

240ad0e3-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Unlocking the potential of GoogleAnalytics logs using Google BigData services
240ad0e3-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Need to clean/format your Google-Analytics (GA) logs to import into your data-warehouse? Need to quickly and painlessly join your GA data with other data sources (CRM, YouTube)? Need to mine your GA data and create custom market segments? In this session, we will sketch how you can unlock all the potential in your GA logs by melding GA-Premium (no sampling!), BigQuery (fast insights) and BigData services.

24567fb5-37fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: How to distribute new technology
24567fb5-37fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Is Leap Motion's motion-based technology the future of human computer interaction? Discover why Fast Company calls CEO Michael Buckwald one of the 100 Most Creative People and learn how he leveraged early adopters to distribute a groundbreaking technology.

27e25f0d-0ae1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Organizing code and managing dependencies
27e25f0d-0ae1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Not sure how to organize your Go projects? Trapped in a maze of twisty dependencies, all alike? In this session we'll look at some practical examples of how to organize Go code into packages and how to manage third party dependencies for distribution and deployment.

28b28b7e-71dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Enable Google Cast for your application
28b28b7e-71dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

28b59e00-e4da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Design sprints with Google Ventures
28b59e00-e4da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this hands-on workshop, you'll get practice with design techniques that you can use to gather data about customers, get your team focused on the same challenges, quickly sketch new ideas, and turn those sketches into prototypes. The Google Ventures design team has helped over 80 startups with these techniques. Now we're sharing what we've learned in this 2 hour crash course. No design experience necessary, just come ready to have fun. Capacity: 100 people.

28d69aa3-c7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building set-top box UIs with Dart
28d69aa3-c7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how the Dart VM can be embedded onto devices, and how Dart can be used to build responsive UIs for TVs, directly from engineers working on Google Fiber. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

2de7cc37-55fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Quantified Self meetup
2de7cc37-55fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Do you track all your steps, calories, workouts, sleep hours, etc.? This is a meetup for Quantified Self buffs.

2e495037-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Scaling NoSQL performance on Google Cloud Platform
2e495037-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Using Cassandra as an example, we'll walk through the steps we took to drive a 1 million requests / second benchmark against Google Cloud Platform.  Follow us on a deep dive into tuning the performance of VMs, Network and Block storage to make your NoSQL database scream in the Cloud.

2e798250-33e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Smartphone websites: UX review
2e798250-33e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Bring along your smartphone website for a live review. Our reviews will be based on data that revealed best practices in mobile website design.

2f856054-38fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: How Tinder caught fire & how your app can too
2f856054-38fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: How did Tinder become a viral sensation without spending a dollar on marketing? Founder & CEO Sean Rad reveals how he distributed the popular social app that has facilitated over 1 billion matches between members.

30238142-bbe6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Renderscript
30238142-bbe6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

30e74356-84e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessibility Q&A, consulting, and demos
30e74356-84e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

30f22dc0-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Education APIs
30f22dc0-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

31a69cd4-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Introduction to Classroom
31a69cd4-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

31c57f0e-31e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Design community panel
31c57f0e-31e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Industry designers share their opinions on design in today's multi-device world, design workflow, and more.

321f31ef-efe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: How to distribute on Chrome Web Store
321f31ef-efe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The Web Store is a place where Chrome users can find and install hosted and packaged apps, extensions and themes. This session will focus on various aspects of effective distribution through the Web Store, including publishing, monitoring user feedback, monetization and tracking statistics.

3269ceba-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Devices and testing Office Hours with Intellijoy and Splash Math
3269ceba-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

342e653f-22e8-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Using JavaScript libraries with Dart
342e653f-22e8-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Choosing Dart for your next project doesn't mean you need to rewrite everything. Learn how to join Dart code with JavaScript, increase reuse, and get the best of both worlds. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

34804eda-40f3-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Strengthening communities with technology: A discussion with Bay Area Impact Challenge finalists
34804eda-40f3-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: There’s arguably no area today where innovation is more critical than in the nonprofit sector — it’s an area trying to reach billions of people and crack some of the most complex issues faced by society. From expanding access to social services for low-income residents to improving access to education, social entrepreneurs are increasingly using technology to create new solutions to old problems. Google’s Impact Challenges travel the world asking social entrepreneurs to tell us their ideas for using technology to make their local community a better place. Winners receive funding and Google support to make their ideas a reality. This is a unique opportunity to hear from three Bay Area winners, One Degree, Beyond 12 and Hack the Hood, understand their inspiration for changing the world, and learn about how you as a developer can do transformative things with technology in your local community.

34d03aa7-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessible web components
34d03aa7-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

34eb8fc7-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Cross-platform design panel
34eb8fc7-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this panel, Google designers will share their thoughts on designing for multiple platforms.

37c3ed89-c7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Server-side Dart programming in Google Cloud
37c3ed89-c7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Run Dart apps on the server with the Dart VM's support for HTTP, Web sockets, SSL, TCP, UDP, and more. Learn how to build and deploy fast server-side apps with Dart and Google Cloud. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

383fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Material design in Google Play
383fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Inspirational design”

Get an inside look at how Google designers approach the process of concepting and developing the latest generation of Google products by leveraging capabilities of the platform.

3888155e-32b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.title: How we built Chrome Dev Editor with the Chrome platform
3888155e-32b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.description: The Chrome Apps platform is familiar (it's the web stack you know and love) and powerful (filesystems, cross-platform, hardware APIs, and more). We challenged ourselves to use all capabilities of the platform to build a developer editor for multi-device apps. How did we do? You'll have to stop by to find out :) In this session, you'll learn how to use Chrome Apps, Polymer, Dart, JavaScript, and the modern web to deliver great cross-platform apps. Along the way, we'll show you how we built Chrome Dev Editor and teach you valuable lessons learned that you can use in your next app.

38a6bb3b-8ffc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Distributing your product: Personalized coaching with Alan Masarek
38a6bb3b-8ffc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Distribution begins with distilling your startup's message. Following his interview, we’ll have former Quick Office CEO and Google Partnerships Director Alan Masarek on hand to take your elevator pitch and polish it so you're armed to speak with customers, partners, and investors. We'll record your "before" and "after" pitches and upload it to your YouTube channel so you can see your improvement first-hand. Each session will be about 7 min. First come, first served.

39066a0d-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Scaling NoSQL performance on Google Cloud Platform
39066a0d-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Using Cassandra as an example, we'll walk through the steps we took to drive a 1 million requests / second benchmark against Google Cloud Platform.  Follow us on a deep dive into tuning the performance of VMs, Network and Block storage to make your NoSQL database scream in the Cloud.

3956992c-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Android Studio startup station
3956992c-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Android experts about how to setup your Android development environment using Android Studio and Gradle. Create your first project and run your Android app on an emulator or device. Capacity: 10 people.

3afa4ddf-cdda-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: You want me to measure what?! Turning qualitative information into quantitative data
3afa4ddf-cdda-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: How can we answer questions about the quality of an experience? Do people like it? Is it fun? The most common measurements we use are quantitative, but how do we evaluate the quality of a design? How can we measure subjective experiences such as "intuitive", "understandable", or "frustrating?" You will learn research and analysis methods, and collaborate on hands-on exercises to apply these methods to your own designs and products. Capacity: 100 people.

3bafc5f2-46cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Play Games: Evolution of our beloved form of entertainment
3bafc5f2-46cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how Android and Google Play Games enable mobile games to bring players together.  Never before has there been such a diverse audience of people playing video games everywhere. This form of entertainment creates a social fabric that brings us together, and the ubiquity of mobile devices represents an evolution of that fabric.  We’ll discuss how developers are making successful experiences using games services, and how to enable engaging and exciting new game play scenarios whether your game has single player, multiplayer or community-like mechanics.

3d66ffaf-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Cloud Platform startup station
3d66ffaf-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Google Cloud Platform experts about how to setup your own development environment for building awesome cloud apps. Create your first project and learn how to use the Google Developers Console and the Google Cloud SDK command line tool to create a new Compute Engine virtual machine. Capacity: 10 people.

3fb9bee5-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessibility developer tools in Chrome
3fb9bee5-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

410cedbc-d6e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Mobile Dart workflows in Chrome Dev Editor
410cedbc-d6e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how Chrome engineers built the Chrome Dev Editor with Polymer, Chrome Apps, and Dart. Watch them demonstrate multi-screen and mobile workflows, by launching and debugging apps directly on phones and tablets. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers who built full-featured apps with the Chrome platform.

411a42d8-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Cloud Platform startup station
411a42d8-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Google Cloud Platform experts about how to setup your own development environment for building awesome cloud apps. Create your first project and learn how to use the Google Developers Console and the Google Cloud SDK command line tool to create a new Compute Engine virtual machine. Capacity: 10 people.

44d22a02-cdfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Nest API startup station
44d22a02-cdfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Nest is now open to developers interested in building new applications and experiences that works with Nest products. Join us as we explore the realtime technology behind the Nest API and walkthrough the steps to create a realtime Android app that integrates with the Nest API.

45cb3f5a-56fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Meetup en Español
45cb3f5a-56fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants who speak Spanish.

45cb9eb4-90fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Distributing your product: Personalized coaching with Patrick Sullivan
45cb9eb4-90fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Distribution begins with distilling your startup's message. We’ll have Patrick Sullivan, Google Strategic Partner Development Manager and RightsFlow founder, on hand to take your elevator pitch and polish it so you're armed to speak with customers, partners, and investors. We'll record your "before" and "after" pitches and upload it to your YouTube channel so you can see your improvement first-hand. Each session will be about 7 min. First come, first served. Each session will be about 7 min. First come, first served.

46e09100-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Authentication and third party APIs
46e09100-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Baffled by OAuth2, JWT, service accounts, credentials, and cloud projects? In this session we'll give you a quick start at authenticating with Google services and other APIs using OAuth.

473fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Grow your app with Google identity: Engaging users wherever they are
473fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Learn how to grow your audience and user engagement by integrating Google+ Sign-in.  The Google+ platform team will share best practices and insights, with examples from companies like Hotel Tonight and Deezer that have increased registration velocity and Android app downloads.  You’ll learn tips on how to:
- Get more of your content in Google Search
- Drive more Android app installs
- Automatically sign in users across devices
- Generate user notifications that appear across Google properties
- And more!

483ddde6-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Designing great apps for education
483ddde6-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

492aed57-d7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Unlock the next era of UI development with Polymer
492aed57-d7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Entering the multi-screen era means rethinking how we build our applications. Producing a few PSDs doesn't cut it anymore, we have to start seeing the things we design as components within larger systems. Join us to learn how to use Polymer to revolutionize your design process. With these new tools we can create the UIs of the future, and shorten the time between concept and reality.

49afd3f5-cbfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Maker meetup
49afd3f5-cbfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Makers among the Google I/O attendees. Come ready to share your latest projects.

4b08a85c-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Testing techniques
4b08a85c-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session we will show you how to get the most out of Go's testing infrastructure. We'll look at everything from simple unit tests to end-to-end integration tests.

4b807b2e-f1e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: How to get, keep and monetize users on Google Play
4b807b2e-f1e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Overview of Google Play followed by a panel discussion with developers on the following topics: user acquisition, engagement and monetization.

4b81991c-f2e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Distributing appealing apps: How to make them love your apps
4b81991c-f2e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: We all want our apps to be loved by our users. This is because loved apps and products get users on board and keep them engaged. We all strive to create the perfect engaging design that users will like—ultimately love—and want to use over and over and never abandon. Sounds like a love story? It sure is. Why? This is because our users actually do fall in love with great applications as a result of subconscious mating patterns when they interact with the applications we distribute. This is what makes these application so easy to distribute among users. So, if you want to design an app which will be easily distributed, you must understand the relationship between humans and apps. In this presentation, you will be introduced to a framework for creating applications that are both attractive and appealing and therefore, distributable. You will learn some tips on how to design apps that will instantly catch the user’s attention—call it love at first sight, be fun to use and be less prone to be abandoned. Now, don’t we all want to create such applications?

4bb41d15-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Live UX review: Android
4bb41d15-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: We review your Android apps and provide live feedback. Nominations are now closed but drop in to check out the reviews.

4bdebcad-11da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Biologically inspired models of intelligence
4bdebcad-11da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: For decades Ray Kurzweil has explored how artificial intelligence can enrich and expand human capabilities. In his latest book, How To Create A Mind, he takes this exploration to the next step: reverse-engineering the brain to understand precisely how it works, then applying that knowledge to create intelligent machines. In the near term, Ray's project at Google is developing artificial intelligence based on biologically inspired models of the neocortex to enhance functions such as search, answering questions, interacting with the user, and language translation. The goal is to understand natural language to communicate with the user as well as to understand the meaning of web documents and books. In the long term, Ray believes it is only by extending our minds with our intelligent technology that we can overcome humanity’s grand challenges.

4ec51a83-4acb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Containerizing the Cloud with Docker on Google Cloud Platform
4ec51a83-4acb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Have you ever wondered about the core technologies that enable Google to rapidly build reliable distributed systems, while simultaneously increasing data center reliability and efficiency? In 2006, Google developed Linux container technology that enabled world leading fleet utilization, efficiency and scale.  More recently, these same core technologies formed the foundation of Docker, the popular, new open source container environment.  

Join us in this session and see how containers are re-making the cloud computing landscape. Learn how Google Cloud Platform is making itself the best place in the world to run container images.  Come see how containers and Google Cloud Platform make it easier to build, run and maintain distributed systems, by building on the same core container technologies that power all of Google.  Get a first look at Kubernetes, the new open source container cluster management implementation that turns these concepts into reality. Come learn how containers and Google Cloud Platform make the technology and application architectures that power Google available to all developers across the world.

4f0c217f-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Designing great apps for education
4f0c217f-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

4f160474-befc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: After Hours
4f160474-befc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: We look forward to hanging out with you tonight at After Hours from 6:30pm - 10:00pm PDT at Yerba Buena Gardens; the entrance will be at Howard and 4th street -- pro tip: bring sleeves!

4f4e4aa1-b7b3-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.title: Material science: Developing Android applications with material design
4f4e4aa1-b7b3-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Advanced Android UI”

This session will dive into the details of how to write an application for Android using the new material design system, including the new theme, styles, and APIs that you can take advantage of to enrich your applications with the dynamic capabilities that material design enables.

51308d7c-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Large scale data processing in the Cloud
51308d7c-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Bring your own big data processing scenario, and let's see how Google's newest product for doing large scale data processing can help you clearly express and efficiently execute your pipeline.

51547c77-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Android Studio startup station
51547c77-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Android experts about how to setup your Android development environment using Android Studio and Gradle. Create your first project and run your Android app on an emulator or device. Capacity: 10 people.

519d6e77-37b4-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.title: Building great multi-media experiences on Android
519d6e77-37b4-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.description: Performance and innovative capabilities are essential in building a successful media app. Join the Android media team for a look at new and recent features and how you can use them to optimize performance and create great user experiences. We’ll start with best practices for audio and video APIs and go on to look at what's new in the Android camera API.

5277ff27-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Optimizing your app for education
5277ff27-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

53ea825c-80bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play power session
53ea825c-80bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The multi-device mobile app world presents huge opportunities for developers to connect with users, and Google Play is one of the richest and most competitive business ecosystems on the planet. Understand how to leverage the complete suite of Google products to make a great app, build your userbase, expand your app onto new device types, and reach people globally.

55392c77-15e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Tips and tricks for upgrading business critical web apps to Dart
55392c77-15e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Business critical apps can just stop running for a rewrite. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers as they share their tips and lessons from upgrading Adwords Frontend to Dart.

5673c0d5-e7be-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Redesigning Google Maps
5673c0d5-e7be-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: How do you redesign a product used by a billion people?  The Google Maps team recently launched their biggest redesign since the product was introduced 8 years ago.  The lead designers will take you through the journey, illustrating three lessons learned that can apply to any design and product development process.

56b3c3ef-ccfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Nest API startup station
56b3c3ef-ccfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Nest is now open to developers interested in building new applications and experiences that works with Nest products. Join us as we explore the realtime technology behind the Nest API and walkthrough the steps to create a realtime Android app that integrates with the Nest API.

585c7e67-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Developer workflow around Docker containers
585c7e67-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Docker is gaining a lot of traction as a way to make deploying applications on Cloud Platforms easier. This session will take a look at how we can build tooling around Docker, Docker containers to improve the application lifecycle for Developers.

58682893-4ffd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Apps in school: Kids Panel
58682893-4ffd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

58902b38-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Framework: Device storage and SD cards, NFC/HCE APIs and behaviors
58902b38-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

5897b1e4-c7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building end-to-end apps with Cloud, Mobile, and Dart
5897b1e4-c7b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Dart runs on the server and on the client. Learn how to build end-to-end apps with the Dart runtime, language, libraries, and toolchain. You'll see how to deploy server-side apps with the Dart VM, and client-side apps by compiling Dart to JavaScript. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

59cf6cb7-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Francophone meetup
59cf6cb7-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants who speak French.

5b7836c8-82bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making money on Google Play
5b7836c8-82bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Developers are finding great success on Google Play. In this session, we’ll review developer success stories and the drivers of revenue, and we’ll share tips for developers to get the most out of Google Play.

5b895f39-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Taking on accessibility challenges in complex web applications
5b895f39-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

5de1fb19-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Go compilation complexities
5de1fb19-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session gccgo author Ian Lance Taylor will look at some of the complexities of compiling Go code.

5e5915de-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Sourcegraph: A code search engine in Go
5e5915de-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: SourceGraph is a code search and analytics engine that indexes the world of open source code. In this session we'll see how a small team used Go to build the service.

5e730d57-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building a Lambda Architecture in 10 minutes with BigQuery, CEP and Docker
5e730d57-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: If you are collecting access logs from 100 web servers with >100K req/s, how do you draw a graph of req/s from the logs for last 12 months and update it every 3 sec? You'd need a design pattern called "Lambda Architecture", a combination of real-time and big data processing. In this session, we will show how you can take advantage of the power of Docker to deploy a large scale LA in 10 min with BigQuery and Complex Event Processing (CEP) tool.

603fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Cardboard: VR for Android
603fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled: "Field of View"

Cardboard is a simple DIY enclosure that transforms a phone into a basic virtual reality headset and the accompanying open software toolkit. Cardboard makes it easy for both users and developers to experiment with VR. In this session we discuss how to build immersive 3D experiences for Android. We give a deep dive into 3D side-by-side rendering, head tracking, and user interaction principles. We introduce a new open source VR toolkit and walk through using it to create a sample immersive app.

60803f70-fbe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play office hours
60803f70-fbe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Come and talk to our Google Play team.

60ca1d61-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Unity tooling and performance
60ca1d61-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Meet with performance minded engineers for Unity Technologies! This session will present techniques for making high performance games for Android using Unity. Techniques will range from general tips for working with Unity to in depth CPU and GPU optimizations. Bring your Unity project and get expert help and hints on making the best games!

62947f9d-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Chrome apps in Google Play for Education
62947f9d-a2fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

63bcf3f1-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Open-source technologies from the Hadoop ecosystem as part of your Cloud toolkit
63bcf3f1-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: See how the flexibility and expressiveness of open-source data processing/analytics software can be mixed and matched seamlessly on Google Cloud Platform. With the help of our connectors and tools for interoperability across several Google Cloud products, you'll be able to select the right tool(s) for the right jobs as they come.

64bf2234-4bcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Introduction to Project Volta
64bf2234-4bcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: No one likes battery-draining apps. We’ve analyzed power use by the platform and apps and want to share what we've found in this talk. We will go over best power practices, and familiarize you with some tools for measuring power consumption. We'll also describe a couple APIs that make it easy for you to write applications that drain less battery. Join us in helping improve battery life for our users.

65825550-a4fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: New to Android with Showbie and Tynker
65825550-a4fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

692f0195-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: What's new in Google Play for Education
692f0195-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

6aabd894-c6e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: GC and Jank in Art
6aabd894-c6e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

6ac744ee-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: BigQuery logs analysis
6ac744ee-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: BigQuery provides an interactive analysis platform for slicing, dicing and mining logs for further analysis and visualization. In this session, we'll explore getting started with logs analysis with BigQuery, and going beyond to create and analyze time series data for outliers and more.

6ae47f24-b9bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Innovate with the Glass Platform
6ae47f24-b9bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The Glass platform has expanded dramatically with the introduction of the GDK and recent update to KitKat.  This session will provide a deep analysis of the Glass software platform and provide developers with tools, APIs, and sample code to build truly innovative user experiences on Glass.

6afab049-ede5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Silicon Valley startups and incubators vs. global ones
6afab049-ede5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Are Silicon Valley startups different than non-Silicon-Valley ones? Where is it best to grow your startup? What are the challenges of startups in the valley and around the world?

6c981da3-a3fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Devices and testing Office Hours with Nearpod, Inc
6c981da3-a3fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

6caa6dcb-57b4-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.title: Material witness: How Android material applications work
6caa6dcb-57b4-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Graphical Android: Rich effects for great user interfaces”

This session will dive deeply into two different aspects of the new material design experience of the Android platform. The first half will focus on an application that was written explicitly to take advantage of material design capabilities to provide a rich experience for users. Developers will see how to apply similar techniques to create rich applications of their own. The second part of this talk will dive into some of the internals of how various capabilities of material design on Android work; it will provide an interesting look under the covers to see how platform functionality evolves and how to achieve high-performance, rich effects in constrained situations.

6d5eb13d-c9f7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Security at scale at Google
6d5eb13d-c9f7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: For most developers, the security team at Google is a black box. Yet Safe Browsing and its API have been around for years and currently protect over a billion users. We also recently launched the source code to End-To-End, an encryption extension for Chrome, where we're explicitly calling for community feedback. And then there's the Google Transparency Report, which includes information both from Safe Browsing and from our Safer Email effort to understand how much encrypted email we send and receive. Please join us for a session about how Google's security team approaches its work, updates about End-To-End, Safe Browsing, and Safer Email, and how developers can tap into what we do.

6d7362a5-4abf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android Auto: Developers, start your engines!
6d7362a5-4abf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: This is a developer-focused session that goes “under the hood” on the just-announced Android Auto SDK.  The session will go into depth on our API set, including coding examples, and also more detail on the Android Auto technology solution.  Learn what it takes to car-enable your audio or messaging app now so you're ready for the launch of Android Auto later this year!

6e716cdb-49cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Big data, the Cloud way: Accelerated and simplified
6e716cdb-49cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Making sense of your Big Data problems doesn't have to require a herculean effort. Deriving meaning from your data, at any scale, doesn't have to involve a tangle of clusters, configurations, and scripts that takes a team of specialized administrators to unravel. In fact, you can make it manageable and easy for all developers without losing insight in the process. We've created easy-to-use services so that you can run deep analytics on both streaming and historical data with as little effort as hosting an app on App Engine. 

However, sometimes, you need more control and configurability than managed services allow. That doesn't mean that you lose all the benefits of the Big Data tools that Google Cloud Platform has developed. You can easily combine managed services, where it makes sense, with Open Source tools like Hadoop and Spark. This session will dive into what you can use today to manage Big Data like Google itself does, “the Cloud way”, as well as how you can plan to scale as your data needs shift and mature.

6f371adb-06b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.title: Making the mobile web fast, feature-rich, and beautiful
6f371adb-06b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.description: Reintroducing the mobile web! What is the mobile web good at? Why should developers build for it?  And how do mobile web and native complement each other?  The mobile web is often the first experience new users have with your brand and you're on the hook for delivering success to them. There's been massive investment in mobile browsers; so now we have the speed, the features, and the tools to help you make great mobile web apps.

6f73856f-9ad4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making music mobile with the Web
6f73856f-9ad4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Join us as we record, live and onstage, a custom "Theme for I/O" song using the mobile web. With WebRTC, Web Audio, Dart, and Chrome for Android, Soundtrap built a collaborative music authoring system. We'll show you how to add real-time communication and audio to your mobile web app.

6fe20716-32d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Ignite
6fe20716-32d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Ignite is a series of five-minute presentations for geeks. Each speaker gets 20 slides that auto-advance after 15 seconds. Come prepared to for rapid-fire ideas from all over the world.

711a595b-70ca-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Perf culture
711a595b-70ca-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: With the rising tide of mobile traffic, we need to adapt our company cultures to prioritize the UX of the mobile user. What is the best way to excite your colleagues to meet your enthusiasm for delivering a quick and responsive experience on the mobile web? Join Lara and Paul to explore how to curate a culture of performance internally. We can be deliberate about performance and mobile web, make smart use of performance monitoring tools, and cultivate a social atmosphere of collaboratively improving performance for our mobile users.

71b6e8cb-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Cloud Platform startup station
71b6e8cb-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Google Cloud Platform experts about how to setup your own development environment for building awesome cloud apps. Create your first project and learn how to use the Google Developers Console and the Google Cloud SDK command line tool to create a new Compute Engine virtual machine. Capacity: 10 people.

743fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Zero to hero with Google Cloud Platform
743fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Ready to take the leap into the Cloud with your next application? This talk will build the foundation, providing you with a developer overview of Google Cloud Platform. You will learn the basic building blocks of the Cloud Platform in the context of solving real-world problems from a developer’s point of view. We will also pull back the covers on a some key technologies so as to give you a better understanding of how they really work in order to allow you to get the most out of them as a developer. Finally we’ll show you  a few early glimpses of new services and tools that will be coming soon to the platform and give you an insight into how we’re looking to change the way that you develop applications in the Cloud today.

76508525-84e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: API case study from IDEAL Group
76508525-84e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

78608e7f-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessibility developer tools in Chrome
78608e7f-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

78f11d22-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making your code faster: benchmarking and profiling
78f11d22-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: This session will show you how to get the most out of Go's superb benchmarking tools.

793fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: The dawn of "Fast Data"
793fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Do you need simple, flexible, and powerful ways to process data of any size and from different sources? In this session we unveil a new system that enables you to rapidly build and execute data pipelines which can be used to ingest huge volumes of streaming data while simultaneously performing continuous, near-real-time analytics. You’ll learn how you can easily build complex data pipelines that can be used to seamlessly cross the data processing boundaries from batch to streaming, all on a system that is fully managed and optimized within the Google Cloud Platform. 
Come see how easy it is for you to move beyond just Big data and equip yourself with all the tools that you need to move into the world of ‘Fast Data’

79edef8b-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Material design principles
79edef8b-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Cross-platform design”

Design is the art of considered creation. As designers, our goal is to satisfy the diverse spectrum of human needs. As those needs evolve, so too must our designs, practices, and philosophies.

We challenged ourselves to create a visual language for our users that synthesizes the classic principles of good design with the innovation and possibility of technology and science. The result is material design: a cross-platform design system grounded in tactile reality, inspired by our study of paper and ink, yet open to imagination and magic.

In this session, design leads across Google discuss the key principles of material design, and set the stage for the later sessions focusing on interaction, motion and visual design.

7b7605ad-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Continuous integration with Google Cloud Release Pipelines
7b7605ad-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: One of cloud's promises is to reduce your devops workload and allow your development to be more agile. In this session we will demo how to use the upcoming version of Google Cloud Release Pipelines to release your application through a multi-stage built/test/deployment pipeline. The Release Pipeline is based on tools you are already familiar with such as Jenkins, Maven and Git. Many of the repetitive tasks are automated so you can spend more time on your application. At the same time you will have visibility and control over how your application is released.

7ba3945c-13e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Debugging Dart apps with WebStorm
7ba3945c-13e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Dart is designed to be highly toolable, giving developers increased productivity. Learn how to use Dart with WebStorm, a web development environment from JetBrains, for development and debugging. Get expert answers and advice from WebStorm engineers.

7bd26b83-7abf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Material design: Visual style and imagery
7bd26b83-7abf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Cross-platform visual design”

This session will reveal the invisible structures behind the material design system. Designers will show how to use the new color systems, typographic strategies, and the underlying grids that hold it together. They will show how imagery and the new framework material rendering can make apps more interesting and communicate more quickly.

7d002b00-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Camlistore: Android, ARM, App Engine, everywhere
7d002b00-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session Brad Fitzpatrick will talk about writing Go code that runs in a variety of environments: from the command line to the cloud to your pocket.

7facf6b4-cef9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Europe meetup
7facf6b4-cef9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from Europe.

7fd7c9bb-38fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: How to grow a global user base
7fd7c9bb-38fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Powered by Google for Entrepreneurs, Startup Grind has provided educational resources for over 75,000 founders in 42 countries. CEO Derek Anderson shares how he built his business and expanded it across the globe.

81c71952-6cbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Developing across Devices - Chrome DevTools in 2014
81c71952-6cbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Save and Refresh is dead. Developing for desktop first is out. Let's open our eyes to what modern cross-device development is like. Get a sneak peek of the next-generation workflow: mobile-driven productivity, addressing top performance issues easy, and staying focused on our code, rather than JS libraries.

81dbc6ca-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Optimizing your app for education
81dbc6ca-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

81dffe45-d1f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Asia meetup
81dffe45-d1f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from Asia.

825e0a5a-3cbc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: The next five billion gamers
825e0a5a-3cbc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In the coming decade, 5 billion people will come online for the first time; And with more than 3 billion hours a week spent playing games globally, make no mistake, they will be gamers. To meet this demand, Developers need to focus on building for a global market place, across an ecosystem of devices, culturalized for the audience and targeted at regions with intermittent connectivity. This talk introduces this new generation of gamers, their challenges, and what opportunities lie ahead for developers who embrace them.

828cdf0d-ede5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: 3 days of building useless stuff - the makings of the world's craziest makers conference
828cdf0d-ede5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Join Eden Shochat, to talk innovation, organized chaos and entrepreneurial spirit. Eden founded GeekCon (geekcon.com) an un-conference in its 10th year that hosts makers, designers, artists, hackers and code monkeys, who spend 3 days teamed up to build anything from a laughing swing, solar sausage cooker, a tomato tank, “Superman” flight simulator, full body security access authenticator or large-scale kitesurfing simulator. The only requirement is that the projects need to be utterly useless.

82cdc8f7-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessible web components
82cdc8f7-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

839764dd-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: GC and Jank in Art
839764dd-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

847e9312-a8ba-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Perfectly executing the wrong plan
847e9312-a8ba-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
App developers ask themselves excellent questions about their users: Do people need my app? Can people use my app? Why do people sign up and then not use my app? However, app developers answer their excellent questions in invalid and unreliable ways. It is shocking to see how much effort app developers put in writing elegantly structured, refactored code, with good unit test coverage in an agile environment, and yet, their apps fail miserably. 

This talk will inspire developers to implement valid and reliable ways to answer their most burning questions. It’ll help them validate or invalidate their assumptions on their own—cheaply, and quickly, by using simple user research techniques with a main goal in mind: developing apps people need, want, and enjoy.

84d2d68d-a2bc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: HTTPS Everywhere
84d2d68d-a2bc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Data delivered over an unencrypted channel is insecure, untrustworthy, and trivially intercepted. We must protect the security, privacy, and integrity of our users data. In this session we will take a hands-on tour of how to make your websites secure by default: the required technology, configuration and performance best practices, how to migrate your sites to HTTPS and make them user and search friendly, and more. Your users will thank you.

84f14e7d-22e8-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessing Cloud Datastore from Dart
84f14e7d-22e8-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how to use Dart to access Google Cloud Datastore, a scalable NoSQL store. Connect from App Engine, Compute Engine, or your own cloud. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

85311b0e-70ca-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android fireside chat
85311b0e-70ca-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Pull up a chair and join the Android platform team for a fireside chat. It's your opportunity to ask us about the platform and learn a little bit more about why things work the way they do, from the people who built it. Moderated by Android Developer Advocate Reto Meier.

856f0534-33e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Live UX review: Android
856f0534-33e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: We review your Android apps and provide live feedback. Nominations are now closed but drop in to check out the reviews.

8915a215-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Education APIs
8915a215-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

8a560a56-c6e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Frameworks for enterprise and device management
8a560a56-c6e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

8be57c62-2cfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Driving login velocity across multiple platforms with Google+ Sign-In
8be57c62-2cfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: In this session, learn about the latest on Google's initiatives to help grow your audience. Hear examples from companies like Hotel Tonight and Deezer that are using Google's platforms to increase user login and registration velocity, drive more Android downloads, and engage users across multiple platforms and devices. Attendees will learn about Google+ Sign-In and how to integrate with it via code samples on how to fetch and handle OAuth tokens (includes incremental authorization), which OAuth scopes you can request user's data with, what you can do once you have the token (includes People APIs, Moments APIs). See what your users experience when they go through Google Sign-In (including over-the-air Android installs and cross-device-sign-on).

8c43d5fb-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Nippon meetup
8c43d5fb-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from Japan.

8d2831b4-f0e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making Google Cast apps discoverable
8d2831b4-f0e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Google Cast is a technology for enabling exciting multi-screen experiences. In this session, we will talk about what Google is doing to make these apps discoverable by users and what developers can do to make sure their apps are surfaced.

9014c782-cff9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google I/O first-timers meetup
9014c782-cff9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for first-time Google I/O participants.

90ff50d6-98fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: How Homejoy swept the competition
90ff50d6-98fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn why Forbes named Homejoy one of the hottest startups of 2013. Founder Adora Cheung shares how the home cleaning service has expanded to over 30 markets between the US and London in less than a year.

923fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Taming your cloud applications with intelligent monitoring
923fe228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Do you run applications in the cloud? How well do you understand what they’re doing? Is Redis overheating? Are all of your Hadoop nodes healthy? Did you notice that spike in errors that you were serving at 3am? Because your users sure did. Luckily, we can help. We’ll show you how you can use Google Cloud Platform’s powerful logging, monitoring, and alerting capabilities to quickly recognize when your applications aren’t behaving or performing well. It’s easy to set up, and it’s easy to use. We’ll demonstrate the integration of Stackdriver’s monitoring and alerting system with the Google Cloud Platform. When you leave this talk, you’ll understand how you can start using our intelligent monitoring, which lets you spend less time on ops and more time developing the next great cloud app!

95a7ccd2-38bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Design principles for a better mobile web
95a7ccd2-38bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Many websites still provide a poor experience on mobile, and so we wanted to develop an in-depth understanding of what differentiates a great and an inferior mobile experience. Our work has resulted in the development of a set of user experience principles for mobile website design. The principles illustrate how to create experiences that support conversion on mobile, whether that be for a purchase, a quote or a lead. The principles have been developed out of a study that Google User Experience Research conducted in partnership with AnswerLab - a user research consultancy. We studied 100 sites with diversity across size and vertical, and held 119 in-person, one-hour usability sessions with Android and iOS smartphone users. We instructed participants to perform key conversion-focused tasks, such as purchasing an item, booking a reservation, or researching plans or prices.  This presentation will illustrate key principles for designing a better mobile web.

95ea79a6-afbe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Designing for wearables
95ea79a6-afbe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Wearable technology requires new design approaches. We'll share our design process for Android Wear and Glass, and tips for developers and designers working in this emerging space.

96080012-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Predicting the future in the Cloud
96080012-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how to utilize the Google Cloud platform and open source tools to predict the future.  We will explore various data processing, modeling and interactive analysis processes used to predict the outcome of professional soccer matches.

96b59603-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android and cloud
96b59603-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

979dc4b5-97fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Distributing your product: Personalized coaching with Victoria Ransom and Alain Chuard
979dc4b5-97fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Distribution begins with distilling your startup's message. Following her interview, we’ll have former Wildfire CEO and Google Product Management Director Victoria Ransom and Google Group Business Product Manager and former Wildfire co-founder Alain Chuard on hand to take your elevator pitch and polish it so you're armed to speak with customers, partners, and investors. We'll record your "before" and "after" pitches and upload it to your YouTube channel so you can see your improvement first-hand. Each session will be about 7 min. First come, first served.

97a5ed81-f7d9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: #AccessibilityMatters
97a5ed81-f7d9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Researchers and designers focusing on accessibility share some considerations for designing accessible apps and web sites.

99bc91a4-84e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Taking on accessibility challenges in complex web applications
99bc91a4-84e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

9a521ba0-dbf7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Optimizing Dart Applications
9a521ba0-dbf7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Use the Dart VM's builtin Observatory tool to analyze and fix performances issues in Dart applications. Peer into a running VM and get real-time feedback on memory and CPU usage.

9a7405ef-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Material design: Paper and ink
9a7405ef-32e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled “Faster mockups with design resources”

Stencils, templates, and icon packs oh my! In this short session, we'll cover a few key physical principles of material design, and then take a look at some of the resources available to designers for quickly building wireframes and mockups using material design.

9b0d1d9c-3bfd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Optimizing for schools with Pearson TestNav and Remind101
9b0d1d9c-3bfd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

9bf77f55-afbe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android Wear: The developer's perspective
9bf77f55-afbe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Take a developer's tour of the Android Wear platform and Google's new wearable APIs. Learn about our simple and powerful tools for creating apps for Android Wear devices and bringing wearable experiences to your Android apps. We'll walk step-by-step through designing and building a small, contextual app for Android Wear.

9c2279d0-63e0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Optimizing the mobile experience with PageSpeed insights
9c2279d0-63e0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

9c6c7104-f1e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play office hours
9c6c7104-f1e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Come and talk to our Google Play team.

9cba49df-b7b3-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.title: What's new in Android
9cba49df-b7b3-e311-b30e-00155d5066d7.description: Join us for a thrilling, guided tour of all the latest developments in Android technologies and APIs. We’ll cover everything that’s new and improved in the Android platform since…well, since the last time.

9d008af4-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: ARM tooling and performance
9d008af4-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Meet build tools that developers can use to profile and debug their games on devices with ARM Mali GPUs. The scope of this presentation is to show how ARM DS-5 and the Mali Graphics Debugger can be used to analyze and debug any Android application, from UIs to games, including WebGL.

9dd52819-bce6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: SDK tools for layouts
9dd52819-bce6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

9e389413-cff9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Developers Group women meetup
9e389413-cff9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google Developers Group (GDG) women.

9ed6cf4a-efbe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: The design sprint: from Google Ventures to Google X
9ed6cf4a-efbe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The design sprint is a process for prototyping and testing any product in 5 days. Using real-world examples, we’ll show how to move faster and increase the overall effectiveness (and happiness!) of your whole team. And we'll offer techniques for teams of any size, from two-person startup to giant enterprise.

9f5d203b-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Predicting the future in the Cloud
9f5d203b-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how to utilize the Google Cloud platform and open source tools to predict the future.  We will explore various data processing, modeling and interactive analysis processes used to predict the outcome of professional soccer matches.

a0497c74-d1c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making sense of online course data
a0497c74-d1c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In the past, a student's college career was summed up with a transcript consisting of about 120 bits of information over 4 years. Today, information can be collected at a much faster rate, every minute the student is online. This session will describe how that information can be used to help students and educators improve the process, and how Google has experimented with online courses, to: (1) learn what material works and what can be improved; (2) evaluate a student's progress; and (3) inform the next generation of online courses.
