a1558cc5-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Cloud Platform startup station
a1558cc5-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Google Cloud Platform experts about how to setup your own development environment for building awesome cloud apps. Create your first project and learn how to use the Google Developers Console and the Google Cloud SDK command line tool to create a new Compute Engine virtual machine. Capacity: 10 people.

a1ce01f1-66e0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Best practices and common mistakes in SEO
a1ce01f1-66e0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

a2505468-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Unity tooling and performance
a2505468-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Meet with performance minded engineers for Unity Technologies! This session will present techniques for making high performance games for Android using Unity. Techniques will range from general tips for working with Unity to in depth CPU and GPU optimizations. Bring your Unity project and get expert help and hints on making the best games!

a360b640-7fdc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Request quest: Test your knowledge of obscure browser behavior
a360b640-7fdc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

a40b31c3-ccfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Nest API startup station
a40b31c3-ccfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Nest is now open to developers interested in building new applications and experiences that works with Nest products. Join us as we explore the realtime technology behind the Nest API and walkthrough the steps to create a realtime Android app that integrates with the Nest API.

a4aa83c8-d2e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Using Polymer with Dart and JavaScript
a4aa83c8-d2e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Web Components give developers better encapsulation, reuse, and extensibility. Learn how to build and use Web Components built with Polymer, and combine both JavaScript and Dart components into a single app. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

a578141e-b6bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: How 20% engineers built Santa Tracker
a578141e-b6bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Built on Google’s developer platform, Santa Tracker lets millions of children and adults track Santa in 34 languages as he delivers presents across the world. The project’s technical leads go behind the scenes to provide insight into the challenges of building a cohesive Google developer platform experience across mobile/desktop web, Android, Chromecast, Maps and Search; all powered by a Go AppEngine backend.

a5f228f0-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Sign-in Office Hours with Quizlet and Duolingo
a5f228f0-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

a72000c7-ece5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: How crashing my startup taught me to work at Y Combinator
a72000c7-ece5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Hindsight is 20/20, especially when it applies to your own unsuccessful startup. Looking back at what happened with Tutorspree has taught me a lot of lessons that come in handy working with our startups at Y Combinator. These are some of the things I learned.

a8995464-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Putting out fires in your production application
a8995464-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Find out how you can use Google Cloud Platform development tools to discover, analyze and fix problems affecting your production application - all without leaving your browser.

a89ba7f2-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Authentication and third party APIs
a89ba7f2-0de1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Baffled by OAuth2, JWT, service accounts, credentials, and cloud projects? In this session we'll give you a quick start at authenticating with Google services and other APIs using OAuth.

a8cf573e-7fbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play Games: A developer perspective
a8cf573e-7fbf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: A panel of high-profile game developers share insights on how to develop successful titles for Android. Hear their approach to user acquisition and engagement; learn about the role of Google Play games services in their Android strategy.

a8ff977e-17c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Wearable computing with Google
a8ff977e-17c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Wearable computing is here and the way we interact with technology will be completely different.  Building cool, fun, and delightful experiences is no longer enough.  They must also be experiences that address specific user problems and never get in the way or take precedence over the user's life.  They must give users all the benefits of technology they've come to expect, and more, while meeting them on their terms in a seamless and intrinsically human way.

In this session, we'll take a look at the constellation of devices that make up not just wearable, but ubiquitous computing.  We'll tie them all together with common design and development practices as well as the Google Platform.  This is the key information that'll get you ready for being part of a sea change of technology that invariably puts the user first.

a9c6a9f4-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Polymer startup station
a9c6a9f4-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how to setup your own development environment for building web apps with Polymer. Install Polymer with Bower and learn how to structure your first app using Web Components. Capacity: 10 people.

ab1b1395-6fca-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Speechless at I/O
ab1b1395-6fca-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: You've seen them present. You've even seen them present at I/O. But you've never seen them present like this. Join Colt, Timothy, Reto, and Chet as they give totally new presentations in totally unpredictable ways. Based on the SF comedy show Speechless, with a tech-conference spin, this session will bring new meaning to the phrase "slide *show*". Joining them will be Speechless creator and professional comedian Sammy Wegent along with a panel of geek-celebrity judges. You'll laugh, you'll learn. Except for the "learn" part.

abd7c1d5-78bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Maximize app engagement, monetization and distribution
abd7c1d5-78bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: You built an app. Awesome. Do you have a monetization plan? An easy way for your users to pay? Does anyone know about it? How are you tracking success? In addition to providing the platforms and tools to design and develop your apps, we also have solutions to help make it discoverable and more profitable. Learn how you can turn your app into a business by understanding your most valuable users, finding more of them, and tailoring the monetization experience for each different group. We can also help enable fast and seamless transactions so users can purchase products or services in your app.

ac46ad42-19c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: What’s new in Android development tools
ac46ad42-19c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Since its introduction last year, we've added a lot of enhancements to Android Studio.  In this session we will provide an in depth tour of the Android development tools and take a closer look at everything new - along with tips and tricks for getting the most out of them!

adcc7448-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Organizing code and managing dependencies
adcc7448-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Not sure how to organize your Go projects? Trapped in a maze of twisty dependencies, all alike? In this session we'll look at some practical examples of how to organize Go code into packages and how to manage third party dependencies for distribution and deployment.

ae493721-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Open-source technologies from the Hadoop ecosystem as part of your Cloud toolkit
ae493721-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: See how the flexibility and expressiveness of open-source data processing/analytics software can be mixed and matched seamlessly on Google Cloud Platform. With the help of our connectors and tools for interoperability across several Google Cloud products, you'll be able to select the right tool(s) for the right jobs as they come.

ae60ba9c-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Qualcomm tooling and performance
ae60ba9c-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Get hands on training with Qualcomm’s Adreno graphics tools through a case study of profiling and performance optimization of a commercial game of your choice. Bring your games/graphics applications and we will help you profile them at the session!

aedd1a4c-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Containers on Google App Engine
aedd1a4c-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Develop locally with Cloud SDK, store images on Google Cloud Storage, deploy containers into production.

af6071ba-56f2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google [x] presents: Solve for X - Accelerating moonshot projects
af6071ba-56f2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description:
Solve for X@IO - Wednesday, June 25th, 3:00pm-5:00pm
Chris White - DARPA + Dan Kaufman - DARPA - on ending human trafficking using search
Sara Menker - Gro Ventures - on big data to make food globally cheap and abundant
Liu Chunlei - Greenovation - on crowd micro-monitoring environmental damage in China
Sarah Bergbrieter - Uni. of Maryland - on microrobotic systems for crisis management

Solve for X@IO - Thursday, June 26, 9:00am-11:00am
Kathleen Fisher - DARPA + Dan Kaufman - DARPA - on enhancing security in a networked world
Michael Girma - GliHub - on hyperlocal learning solutions - from Ethiopia pilot to anywhere
Scott Klemer - UCSD - on designing a world where people teach themselves and each other

Solve for X (www.solveforx.com) is a community of people working to accelerate progress on technology moonshots -- radical technology ideas for solving global problems. Radical in the sense that the solutions could help millions (or billions) of people; that the audacity of the proposals makes them sound like science fiction; and that there is some real breakthrough or new approach that makes us believe these ideas could be brought to life. We meet in-person and online. 

We’re running two special interactive Solve for X sessions at this year’s Google I/O.  After hearing short proposals from three tech pioneers, our audience will breakout into small-group brainstorming -- spending 2/3rds of the time generating ‘yes, and’ feedback (e.g. ideas for resources, funding, scaling), and 1/3rd of the time offering constructive critique (e.g. remaining questions, potential blind spots).  And then we gather to report back. 

Join us! 

< Solve for X is an open platform powered by Google [x] and many partners and friends >

b034dbd9-c7e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Intel tooling and performance
b034dbd9-c7e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Make your NDK app faster in real-time with performance optimization using Intel Graphics Performance Analyzers and Intel Vtune Amplifier. Intel's experts will be onsite, profiling real games and identifying performance opportunities.

b0b2f37b-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Qualcomm tooling and performance
b0b2f37b-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Get hands on training with Qualcomm’s Adreno graphics tools through a case study of profiling and performance optimization of a commercial game of your choice. Bring your games/graphics applications and we will help you profile them at the session!

b0b327f0-31d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Robotics in a new world - Presented by Women Techmakers
b0b327f0-31d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: What should you do when your robot gets a flat tire on Mars? What if you needed to create a robot to save the environment, or a life? Learn from innovative leaders in robotics who have engineered otherworldly solutions.

b35faef0-7abf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Material design: Structure and components
b35faef0-7abf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Formerly titled: “Cross-platform interaction design”

Material design is a single, adaptive approach spanning a variety of devices and form factors. In this session, designers from across Google discuss how material design applies to building your app’s interaction. The talk will cover key characteristics of paper and ink, implications for app structure and layout, and guidelines for using signature UI components.

b4310e6e-eccf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: HTML5 everywhere: How and why YouTube uses the Web platform
b4310e6e-eccf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The web platform has never been better for building and deploying rich interactive applications.  HTML5 allows us to focus on a great user experience across clients.  In this presentation, we'll share the principles, tools and practices that enable us to combat platform fragmentation, move quickly and deploy frequently.

b605b5b8-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessibility for Android custom views
b605b5b8-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

b6a763c2-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: ARM tooling and performance
b6a763c2-c8e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Meet build tools that developers can use to profile and debug their games on devices with ARM Mali GPUs. The scope of this presentation is to show how ARM DS-5 and the Mali Graphics Debugger can be used to analyze and debug any Android application, from UIs to games, including WebGL.

b71bb839-35bc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Polymer and Web Components change everything you know about Web development
b71bb839-35bc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Web components are a game changer. Unlike other new features, the technologies are purely about developer productivity, solving many of web development's shortcomings. Polymer and web components change how we think about, design, and compose web applications. Learn how the Web Components revolution makes you more productive and reduces the cognitive load of being a web developer.

b7309fb4-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Build for the multi-device Web
b7309fb4-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

b750c8da-aebe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: The ART runtime
b750c8da-aebe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: ART is an evolution of the Android runtime, and was first made available as an option on Android 4.4, KitKat. It comes with improvements in the garbage collector, threading and locking model, compiler and runtime performance. In this session, we'll focus on all of the improvements we've been making to the Android runtime.

b7803bbe-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play for Education behind the scenes
b7803bbe-39fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

b89dca95-f6d9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Prototyping with Polymer
b89dca95-f6d9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Designing in code shouldn't require a CS degree. With Polymer we can build rich, interactive prototypes using just HTML and CSS. Let's return web design to its roots, to the time before huge JavaScript frameworks, when designing things actually made sense.

bb6b0b63-71dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: 10 things I learned from the Chrome OS source
bb6b0b63-71dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

bb8bf02d-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Introduction to Classroom
bb8bf02d-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Come by the School Sandbox Teaching Theater to hear from Google Play for Education about the latest exciting announcements and innovations for the classroom.

bb993573-d1da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Glassware design sprint
bb993573-d1da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from one another and prototype new Glassware. In this Design Sprint, we'll examine the principles behind great Glassware (apps for Glass) and put these principles to use immediately. Whether you are a designer or developer, participate in this interactive workshop to explore using Glass to transform how people interact with technology. Capacity: 100 people.

bba2a63d-35fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: How to distribute new technology, part II
bba2a63d-35fd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Discover why Thalmic Labs are changing the paradigm of human-computer interactions with a futuristic armband called the MYO. Co-founder Aaron Grant shares his creative strategies for distributing the innovative armband, which reads electrical muscle activity directly and promises to create effortless interaction with all your devices.

bde4f860-bce6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Framework: Device storage and SD cards, NFC/HCE APIs and behaviors
bde4f860-bce6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

be24e2d4-0be1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Testing techniques
be24e2d4-0be1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session we will show you how to get the most out of Go's testing infrastructure. We'll look at everything from simple unit tests to end-to-end integration tests.

be2ab4cd-56fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Australia and New Zealand meetup
be2ab4cd-56fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from Australia and New Zealand.

c1d65645-32b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.title: Connecting Cloud and Web: Deploying end-to-end apps with Dart
c1d65645-32b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.description: Dart is a language, runtime, and toolset for building scalable web applications for the modern web. We are excited to bring the power and productivity of the Dart platform to the server. In this session you will see how to build a Dart application that spans the server and the browser, debug the application on mobile, and deploy to the recently announced Managed VMs on Google Cloud. You will learn how to structure an application for maximum code reuse, easy maintenance, and fast turn-around.

c1ed987f-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Android Studio startup station
c1ed987f-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Android experts about how to setup your Android development environment using Android Studio and Gradle. Create your first project and run your Android app on an emulator or device. Capacity: 10 people.

c2298098-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Cloud Platform startup station
c2298098-52fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn from Google Cloud Platform experts about how to setup your own development environment for building awesome cloud apps. Create your first project and learn how to use the Google Developers Console and the Google Cloud SDK command line tool to create a new Compute Engine virtual machine. Capacity: 10 people.

c55e3b37-56fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Korean developers meetup
c55e3b37-56fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants who speak Korean.

c64eac22-3bfd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google Drive integration with WeVideo and Explain Everything
c64eac22-3bfd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

c8300366-03ed-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Mobile Web performance auditing
c8300366-03ed-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Building high performance sites and apps is crucial to your success on the web, and never more so as people start using smartphones as their primary means of internet access. But how can you make sure you're squeezing out every last bit of performance from your projects? In this talk we'll look at the tools you need to succeed and how to integrate them into your workflow.

c9105633-d1f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Africa meetup
c9105633-d1f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from Africa.

c9beeb5a-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Android design and tablet optimization with StudyBlue and Handouts
c9beeb5a-3afd-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

c9e32eaf-4acb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: DevOps at the speed of Google
c9e32eaf-4acb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Do you need to build, deploy and maintain a Cloud Application or Service quickly and nimbly? At Google, we do -- and everything that we’ve learned about doing this, we’re bringing to you as part of the Google Cloud Platform. We’ll show you tools and techniques that we provide in our platform for handling complex, global scale operations for extremely high usage services, but which work at your scale no matter how small or large that may be. You’ll come away from this session armed with best-of-breed tools that you can use in your DevOps -- tools that will give you the ability to operate at the speed of Google!

cabd1803-eee5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: AdMob and Google Analytics office hours
cabd1803-eee5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Come and talk to our AdMob and Google Analytics team.

cb05b4ba-efe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Distributing your Glassware
cb05b4ba-efe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Join us for an in-depth discussion of the Glassware review process and the steps you can take to get your Glassware in the hands of Explorers quickly and easily.

cc2f212b-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: BigQuery logs analysis
cc2f212b-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: BigQuery provides an interactive analysis platform for slicing, dicing and mining logs for further analysis and visualization. In this session, we'll explore getting started with logs analysis with BigQuery, and going beyond to create and analyze time series data for outliers and more.

ce929943-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Massively scalable backends for MMO and mobile games
ce929943-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn the key architecture patterns behind the largest games built on Google Cloud Platform.

cebe078b-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Nordics meetup
cebe078b-d0f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Meetup for Google I/O participants from the Nordic countries.

cfcc47b3-d2c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Transforming democracy and disasters with APIs
cfcc47b3-d2c0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Developers around the world are building new tools to help people stay safe during crises, engage with their communities and governments, and more effectively receive public services. What started as hobbies and hackathon projects have evolved into sustainable businesses that serve millions of users around the globe. These tools rely on open data about our societies, governments and physical world, but transform it and make it useful.

Our partner developers around the globe are making people safer and reinvigorating democracies with technology. This presentation will explore the motivations, technologies and challenges behind Google's work with these partners, as well as share what we've learned about how anyone can use their unique skills to make a difference.

d1c1144a-11e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: End-to-end testing and continuous integration with Dart
d1c1144a-11e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how to continually test all layers of your application with Dart and cloud-based, open-source tools and libraries. No bug is safe with this testing workflow. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.

d2e6b61b-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Containers on Google App Engine
d2e6b61b-97e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Develop locally with Cloud SDK, store images on Google Cloud Storage, deploy containers into production.

d5e64519-53fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Polymer startup station
d5e64519-53fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how to setup your own development environment for building web apps with Polymer. Install Polymer with Bower and learn how to structure your first app using Web Components. Capacity: 10 people.

d76b6295-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: SDK tools for layouts
d76b6295-bae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.

d7774ed7-78dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Optimizing for the user experience with WebPagetest
d7774ed7-78dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

d8851a7d-d6e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building composable server-side Dart apps with Shelf
d8851a7d-d6e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The Dart VM ships with HTTP, SSL, Web sockets, and much more. Learn how to use the Shelf package to make it easy to build REST servers, content sites, authenticate your users, and more.

da42f285-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Massively scalable backends for MMO and mobile games
da42f285-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn the key architecture patterns behind the largest games built on Google Cloud Platform.

db540a91-ece5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Keys to successful distribution of Android games
db540a91-ece5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: With over one million Android apps and games on Google Play, it can be difficult to stand out. In this talk, we'll focus on the strategies that successful game developers are taking to build long-lasting user bases. We'll discuss the different distribution strategies and how to choose them, and provide tips and best practices that will help you successfully distribute your games.

dbabf77a-31e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Live UX review: Web
dbabf77a-31e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: We review your web sites and apps and provide live feedback. Nominations are now closed but drop in to check out the reviews.

dc164b6e-91fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Social networking, reengineered: How Secret became popular
dc164b6e-91fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: What if 90% of your users returned within a week of trying your app? With Secret, an anonymous social network, CEO David Byttow has done exactly that. Learn how Byttow built Secret and distributed to users who keep coming back for more.

dc44916c-48e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play services Rocks!
dc44916c-48e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
Google Play services is a unified SDK available to Android developers which makes it easy to integrate Google features into your Android apps, delivered through the Play Store.  This talk will give you a rundown of Google Play services and how your Apps can use this wealth of functionality continuously being pushed to the world.  And of course… we will also present new features and how your Apps can use them to stay ahead of the game.

So join our Google Play services movement, because after this session you will without a shadow of a doubt know that: Google Play services Rocks!

dcf6c68a-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building a Lambda Architecture in 10 minutes with BigQuery, CEP and Docker
dcf6c68a-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: If you are collecting access logs from 100 web servers with >100K req/s, how do you draw a graph of req/s from the logs for last 12 months and update it every 3 sec? You'd need a design pattern called "Lambda Architecture", a combination of real-time and big data processing. In this session, we will show how you can take advantage of the power of Docker to deploy a large scale LA in 10 min with BigQuery and Complex Event Processing (CEP) tool.

de22e147-07b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.title: Polymer and the Web Components revolution
de22e147-07b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.description: A huge opportunity is brewing. One where web development becomes a powerfully rich ecosystem of discoverable, sharable, and reusable components. Polymer is the first library of its kind to fully embrace this brave new web platform. In this session we’ll reveal the latest with Polymer, what Polymer is doing to create an end-to-end workflow for developers and their users, unveil the burgeoning ecosystem of web components, and demonstrate the next generation of web apps. The web components revolution is here. Join us in building the future!

de700129-f7d9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Designing for Google Cast
de700129-f7d9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The lead designer of Chromecast and Google Cast will share the story of how casting came to be, show you the basics of how it works, tell you about some of the issues which trip up developers, and tease you with a juicy glimpse of the future.

de74be73-f1e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: AdMob and Google Analytics office hours
de74be73-f1e5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Come and talk to our AdMob and Google Analytics team.

dee628c9-fbe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play flipped panel
dee628c9-fbe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Google Play Product and Business Development Managers will be turning the tables back to you, and asking developers their thoughts and suggestions on business critical topics.

df3720ac-dab5-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.title: Achieving more with Mobile Cloud
df3720ac-dab5-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.description: Cloud Services help developers succeed by letting them focus on building great apps and user experiences. Today, developers rely on Google Cloud Messaging to deliver messages to their Android users. We're releasing an exciting set of new features to inspire our developers to achieve even more, including upstream messaging, GCM for Chrome, and more.

e2f397e9-60bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Instant Buy Everywhere: Turbocharge mobile monetization
e2f397e9-60bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: One of the top barriers to mobile commerce remains friction during checkout. Google Wallet Instant Buy brings two click checkout to all major platforms: Android, mobile web, and iOS. Besides cross platform support, since last year we have been busy making Instant Buy even better. We’ve worked with developers to make it even easier to integrate and monetize physical goods and services on Android. We’ve listened to buyers and have made using Instant Buy a simpler experience. Whether you are looking to improve your existing app or build the next great mobile commerce app, you’ll want to learn about Instant Buy and how it has improved conversions and sales for developers who are already using it.

e3326a7a-efe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Don't Listen to Users, Sample Their Experience!
e3326a7a-efe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Uncovering user needs is one of the most challenging aspects of product development. Oh-so-many organizations develop beautiful products and services nobody needs. The Experience Sampling Method is a simple research technique for uncovering user needs. In a typical Experience Sampling method, research participants are interrupted several times a day to note their experience in real time. In this talk, Tomer Sharon will demonstrate the method, describe how it has been applied at Google Search, and provide a short, practical how-to guide.

e4c38010-6ebe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Going responsive with the Google Play Apps Suite
e4c38010-6ebe-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
The Google Play apps suite started as five separate projects -- Play Store, Play Music, Play Books, Play Movies and Play Magazines -- each with its own visual style and presence on devices and the web. Through 2013 and 2014 we worked to bring these together under a single design and common brand, with a unified experience across multiple screens and devices.

In this session we’ll look at the Play design to see how it scales along two key vectors: consistency across tasks such as exploring, purchasing and consuming digital content; and consistency across a broad spectrum of screens, from phones to tablets to the web on 30" desktop monitors. We’ll highlight the cards and clusters that organize content and look at the building blocks that let us implement a responsive design. Join us to hear why we set out on this journey and what we’ve learned along the way.

e82578c9-22db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Build better products, not more features: UX design for developers
e82578c9-22db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: This workshop is for developers who want to become part of the design story. It's a starting point, and it will take them through creating designs that are focused on UX & !UI, and also learn to empathize w/ their users (and internalize the user centric design process), in order to create apps that users love! Capacity: 100 people.

e9c150f7-78dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: 10 things I learned from the Chrome OS source
e9c150f7-78dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

ea954ac7-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android accessibility updates
ea954ac7-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

eb5eccef-2fe1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Live UX review: Wearables
eb5eccef-2fe1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: We review your Glass and Android Wear apps and provide live feedback. Nominations are now closed but drop in to check out the reviews.

ebd6611c-d9b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: The future of Apps and Search
ebd6611c-d9b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session, we will talk about the exciting worlds of apps and search working together to deliver the best user experience possible.

ec391c36-d3e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: All-in: Using Dart for everything
ec391c36-d3e1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Learn how Exit Live, a music startup, went "all in" with Dart: server-side and client-side. Exit Live engineers will teach you how they built the infrastructure and apps with Dart. Get expert answers and advice from engineers that launched their startup on Dart.

ecd1a446-fce5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Integrating your app with the Knowledge Graph office hours
ecd1a446-fce5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Talk with Google engineers about the exciting worlds of apps and search working together to deliver the best user experience possible.

ed5a3130-fbe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Google Play office hours
ed5a3130-fbe5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Come and talk to our Google Play team.

eda66d0c-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: NVIDIA tooling and performance
eda66d0c-ebd9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: The NVIDIA Developer Tools team will demonstrate how to optimize NDK Android applications with a comprehensive set of Graphics and CPU performance scenarios. This presentation will cover newly released tools for developers to take advantage of Tegra K1, with the Kepler GPU core, and demonstrate a variety of performance limited situations created with Croteam’s Serious Sam III game engine.

eeb0d873-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Introduction to Android accessibility
eeb0d873-83e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. eeeb1991-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Camlistore: Android, ARM, App Engine, everywhere
eeeb1991-0ce1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: In this session Brad Fitzpatrick will talk about writing Go code that runs in a variety of environments: from the command line to the cloud to your pocket.

f02fa978-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Making your code faster: benchmarking and profiling
f02fa978-0ee1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: This session will show you how to get the most out of Go's superb benchmarking tools.

f3793bac-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Unlocking the potential of GoogleAnalytics logs using Google BigData services
f3793bac-98e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Need to clean/format your Google-Analytics (GA) logs to import into your data-warehouse? Need to quickly and painlessly join your GA data with other data sources (CRM, YouTube)? Need to mine your GA data and create custom market segments? In this session, we will sketch how you can unlock all the potential in your GA logs by melding GA-Premium (no sampling!), BigQuery (fast insights) and BigData services.

f38345a2-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Building App Engine with Gradle in Android Studio
f38345a2-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Now that App Engine is using Gradle in Android Studio, we'll go over how the gradle-appengine-plugin works and how to make it work for you.

f3ef2a6c-70dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Jank-free performance audits
f3ef2a6c-70dc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.

f43815f8-b5bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Views from Everywhere: Bringing developers the world's largest geo photo library
f43815f8-b5bf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Google Maps is creating the world's most comprehensive geolocated photo library through Street View. We're also empowering anyone to contribute photos and 360-degree panoramas to Google Maps via products like Trekker, Business View, Views, and Photo Sphere. In this talk, we'll show how developers can integrate billions of panoramas into their projects. We'll also show how anyone can quickly publish imagery of places they care about, then easily access them via our APIs and viewers. This session is relevant to developers creating experiences that include location and imagery.

f453a195-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Developer workflow around Docker containers
f453a195-95e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Docker is gaining a lot of traction as a way to make deploying applications on Cloud Platforms easier. This session will take a look at how we can build tooling around Docker, Docker containers to improve the application lifecycle for Developers.

f47f19a5-63b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: A 3D tablet, an OSCAR, and a little cash. Tango, Spotlight, Ara. ATAP.
f47f19a5-63b9-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description:
This summer Project Tango launches. On a rocket. To space. Project Tango’s Android smart-phone-like device is scheduled to fly 230 miles above the earth. It will construct a 3D-map of the International Space Station and enable autonomous navigation of a floating robotic platform. The goal: Create a robotic assistant for astronauts. And our earthling activities? Augmented reality, architecture, retail, gaming. We’re harnessing 10 years of advances in computer vision and robotics to build perhaps one of the most powerful mobile devices ever made. One with human-scale understanding of space and motion. Epic.

120 countries, 6,827 developers on line, 48,486 module developer kits downloaded. For the first developer’s conference. Project Ara asks how we bring the benefits of an open hardware ecosystem to 6B people. It’s physical. We want to do for hardware what open platforms have done for software… create a vibrant third-party developer ecosystem, lower the barrier to entry, increase the pace of innovation, and compress development timelines.  

From imaging and authentication to a new creative canvas that powers mobile storytelling. Universities to large scale manufacturers. Your garage to zero g.  

Diversity. Scale. Speed. Google’s Advanced Technology and Projects group. ATAP. A small band of pirates who believe the future is what we choose to make. And that we choose to make what we believe in. We believe the future is awesome. We can build it faster together. ATAP + developers = some epic sh*t.

f5c09cd9-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Continuous integration with Google Cloud Release Pipelines
f5c09cd9-99e6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: One of cloud's promises is to reduce your devops workload and allow your development to be more agile. In this session we will demo how to use the upcoming version of Google Cloud Release Pipelines to release your application through a multi-stage built/test/deployment pipeline. The Release Pipeline is based on tools you are already familiar with such as Jenkins, Maven and Git. Many of the repetitive tasks are automated so you can spend more time on your application. At the same time you will have visibility and control over how your application is released.

f73ee228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Android TV - A platform for the living room
f73ee228-89c5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: With the new release, Android is a single platform across phones, tablets, and televisions - allowing Android developers to extend their reach across all screens to the biggest screen in the house. We've introduced several TV APIs, a TV SDK and UX framework to make this really easy for both content and game developers. This session will cover some background on the television space, a deeper demo of the platform, UX best practices in the 10-ft living room space, and ways for developers to get started.

f7dab6e9-19d7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Maps for good: Saving trees and saving lives with petapixel-scale computing
f7dab6e9-19d7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Satellites have been systematically collecting imagery of our changing planet for more than 40 years, yet until recently this treasure trove of “big data” has not been online and available for high-performance data mining.   This session will cover the new Google Earth Engine technology and experimental API for massively-parallel geospatial analysis on daily-updating global datasets such as Landsat satellite imagery.  Scientists and other domain experts are developing new EE-powered applications which map, measure and monitor our changing planet in unprecedented detail, for the benefit of people and the environment.  Applications include tracking and reducing global deforestation; mapping and mitigating the risks of earthquakes and extreme weather events such as floods and drought; and even creating new kinds of geo-visualizations such as the 2014 Webby award-winning “Timelapse” - a zoomable, browsable HTML5 video animation of the entire Earth from 1984-2012, built from nearly a petabyte of Landsat data. These early results merely hint at what’s now possible.

f8617c16-92fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Spread your app like Wildfire
f8617c16-92fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Distributing your product is even harder when you don't have first mover advantage. Learn how Google Product Management Director and former Wildfire CEO Victoria Ransom overcame the odds — as well as the competition — to reach over 13,000 customers and make a successful exit.

f8d7fffd-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Accessibility for Android custom views
f8d7fffd-82e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.

f915e82c-69ba-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.title: Casting to the future
f915e82c-69ba-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: From the applications built by the thousands of Google Cast developers to our evolving ambient home screen experience, users have only seen a glimpse of the future of the living room.  Please join us as we give you more insight about the making of Chromecast, the vision for multi-screen devices, and the future of the Google Cast ecosystem.

f9a35989-07b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.title: Bridging the gap between the web and apps
f9a35989-07b6-e311-8491-00155d5066d7.description: The web is getting new capabilities! In this tech talk we'll discuss some of the changes that are already available, such as background processing with Service Worker, and also give you a sneak peek at some new APIs we're testing out. Which APIs? You'll have to attend to find out. :) There are some cool demos in store for you and we'd love to get your feedback on our work as we test drive these new capabilities in the coming months.

fbaaedc8-61f2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.title: Google [x] present: Solve for X - Accelerating moonshot projects
fbaaedc8-61f2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description:
Solve for X@IO - Wednesday, June 25th, 3:00pm-5:00pm
Chris White - DARPA + Dan Kaufman - DARPA - on ending human trafficking using search
Sara Menker - Gro Ventures - on big data to make food globally cheap and abundant
Liu Chunlei - Greenovation - on crowd micro-monitoring environmental damage in China
Sarah Bergbrieter - Uni. of Maryland - on microrobotic systems for crisis management

Solve for X@IO - Thursday, June 26, 9:00am-11:00am
Kathleen Fisher - DARPA + Dan Kaufman - DARPA - on enhancing security in a networked world
Michael Girma - GliHub - on hyperlocal learning solutions - from Ethiopia pilot to anywhere
Scott Klemer - UCSD - on designing a world where people teach themselves and each other

Solve for X (www.solveforx.com) is a community of people working to accelerate progress on technology moonshots -- radical technology ideas for solving global problems. Radical in the sense that the solutions could help millions (or billions) of people; that the audacity of the proposals makes them sound like science fiction; and that there is some real breakthrough or new approach that makes us believe these ideas could be brought to life. We meet in-person and online. 

We’re running two special interactive Solve for X sessions at this year’s Google I/O.  After hearing short proposals from three tech pioneers, our audience will breakout into small-group brainstorming -- spending 2/3rds of the time generating ‘yes, and’ feedback (e.g. ideas for resources, funding, scaling), and 1/3rd of the time offering constructive critique (e.g. remaining questions, potential blind spots).  And then we gather to report back. 

Join us! 

< Solve for X is an open platform powered by Google [x] and many partners and friends >

fc0ff803-a4fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.description: Educational app partners showcase their latest innovations in partnership with Google for schools, and give best practices for fellow developers.

fc969041-9ae6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.description: Find out how you can use Google Cloud Platform development tools to discover, analyze and fix problems affecting your production application - all without leaving your browser.

0074b515-46d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Jake is a design partner at Google Ventures. He created Google Ventures’ design sprint process, and has run over 80 sprints with startups like About.me, Nest, AngelList, and Foundation Medicine. He's spoken about design process at Stanford, UC-Berkeley, and Columbia University.

Previously, Jake was a design vigilante at Google, leading sprints for everything from Gmail to Google X to Chrome. Jake also started a 20% project that became Google Hangouts.

Long ago, Jake grew up on a rural island in Washington State. He is currently among the world’s tallest designers.
0074b515-46d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jake Knapp

008eae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Boris is a software engineer, currently focusing on designing and building emerging user interfaces at Google Research. His interests include input & sensors, music & audio, and the web platform. Boris is the author of "Web Audio API" from O'Reilly.
008eae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Boris Smus

027c6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Hélène is a UX Motion Designer for a product design group at Google.

04058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Koh is currently a Business Development Manager for Google Play Games where she leads indie game and influencer outreach and international market strategy. As a hardcore gamer, she works with indie game developers to create best user experiences, building player communities, and launching sustainable businesses on Google Play. She also advises game companies on international expansion and recently spent last year starting the Play business development team in Korea.

Prior to Google, Koh was a strategy consultant at the Cambridge Group, where she helped clients develop and execute growth strategies driven by identifying unmet consumer demand and creating differentiated products and services. She holds a BA in Economics from the University of Chicago. In her free time, she enjoys playing and watching sports ranging from tennis to yoga.
04058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Koh Kim

05b42164-5cd2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Ellie Powers is a product manager at Google Play, focused on developing the apps ecosystem. She joined Google to re-launch the Google Play Developer Console, and is now working to make Play the best place for developers and users alike.
05b42164-5cd2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ellie Powers

08123a82-2bfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: AK is a Group Product Manager in the Google Cast/Chromecast team and has been working on the product since its inception. He joined Google in 2010 and has worked on a variety of TV and mobile related product at Google.
08123a82-2bfb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: AK Kenghe

088eae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Peter Norvig is a Director of Research at Google; previously he directed Google's core search algorithms group. He is co-author of Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, the leading textbook in the field, and co-teacher of an Artificial Intelligence class that signed up 160,000 students, helping to kick off the current round of massive open online classes. He is a Fellow of AAAI, ACM, the California Academy of Science and the American Academy of Arts & Sciences.
088eae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Peter Norvig

090986d1-dacb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jake works in Google Chrome's developer relations team, working on specs, implementations, and ensuring developers have tools to make their jobs less painful. He's a big fan of offline-first, time-to-render optimisations, progressive enhancement, and all of that responsive stuff. He's one of the designers of the ServiceWorker API.
090986d1-dacb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jake Archibald

0931c3d4-59da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Brady Forrest is VP of PCH International’s incubator, Highway1. Previously chair for O’Reilly’s Where 2.0 and Web 2.0 Expo in San Francisco and NYC, Brady continues to write for O’Reilly Radar. He started Ignite, a geek event that has spread to over a hundred cities worldwide. Brady lives in San Francisco, where he builds robots and cars for Burning Man and competes for Mayor of finer establishments. You can track his web travels at Truffle Honey or @brady. Recently, he has started blogging about Burning Man & desert fashion.
0931c3d4-59da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Brady Forrest

0b0644f4-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jason Kinner is an engineer on the Google+ Sign-in team.
0b0644f4-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jason Kinner

0d058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Hirotaka manages the overall Google Play Japan Games and Apps business alliance partnership activities including domestic and global business development. In addition, he provides consulting services and supports several partners in the areas of mobile business and the partnership framework with the objective to create new business opportunities in the Japan market.
0d058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Hirotaka Yoshitsugu

0d4725e4-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Brendan Burns is a Staff Software Engineer at Google, Inc.  He works in the Google Cloud Platform, leading engineering efforts to make the Google Cloud Platform the best place to run containers.  He also manages several other cloud teams including the Managed VMs team, and Cloud DNS.  Prior to working at Google, he was a professor at Union College in Schenectady, NY.  He received a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Massachusetts Amherst, and a BA in Computer Science and Studio Art from Williams College.
0d4725e4-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Brendan Burns

0d6849ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Austin is a Product Manager for Android Wear.  He joined the team in 2013 and is passionate about delivering amazing experiences to users through wearable technology.
0d6849ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Austin Robison

0e90bad7-34fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Frédéric della Faille is the CEO, founder and designer at FrontBack, a social media app around photos. Ex-graffiti artist, he's been designing web stuff since the nineties for various advertising agencies and prestigious brands. Product lover, he decided to quit everything and moving to to the US to build a consumer facing business.
0e90bad7-34fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Frederic Della Failla

108eae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Julia Wilkowski designs learning experiences on Google's engineering education team. Since 2012 she has worked on the instructional, community and research elements of massive open online courses like Power Searching and Mapping with Google. Previously at Google, her projects included revamping new hire orientation, manager training, and training sales teams in Asia and Latin America. 

Prior to joining Google in 2007, Julia trained astronauts at NASA, worked as an instructional designer at Informatica, and taught science to sixth graders. She received an M.A. in Education with a focus on Instructional Technology from San Jose State University and a B.S. in Neuroscience from Brown University.
108eae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Julia Wilkowski

1155ead9-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jonathan Lee is design lead and founding member of Google UXA, a cross-functional group focused on developing a unified design framework across Google’s products and platforms. Prior to Google he was an Art Director at 2x4. Jonathan graduated from Pratt Institute in 2005 with a BFA in Communication Design.
1155ead9-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jonathan Lee

11613bcb-7edb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Babak Pahlavan leads Product Management for Google Analytics. He oversees product & strategy for Mobile Apps, Universal Analytics, Google Tag Manager and Integrations with AdWords, AdMob, YouTube among other aspects of the business. 

Prior to Google, he was the co-founder and CEO of Clever Sense, an analytical context-aware recommendation engine, which was acquired by Google in December of 2011. 

In 2012, Babak was selected as one of the 30 under 30 from Forbes in the technology category. Babak holds a masters degree in EE with focus on CS from Stanford University and Bachelors degree from from UC Berkeley in EE and CS.
11613bcb-7edb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Babak Pahlavan

127c6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Richard is an interaction designer and manager on the Android Design team, leading UI efforts spanning both platform and apps. Prior to joining Google, he designed consumer experiences for TiVo, Sirius, Dell, and AOL.
127c6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Rich Fulcher

14408a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Chris was the technical lead for Google Santa Tracker, a delightful project built by a group of merry volunteers. When not tracking Saint Nick, he is a senior engineer on the Google Developer Relations team, focusing primarily on the Google Maps APIs (mobile and web). You'll often find Chris cruising around on a longboard near Google's offices in Pyrmont, Sydney.
14408a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Chris Broadfoot

154e7442-e4da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
John is a designer and writer who’s worked on consumer, enterprise, and medical software products. As part of the team who redesigned YouTube in 2011, John led design for YouTube Channels. He also helped create FeedBurner, which Google acquired in 2007. 

As a design partner at Google Ventures, John helps startups use design successfully. He’s worked with more than 50 companies, including Pocket, Blue Bottle Coffee, RetailMeNot, and Foundation Medicine. John is also GV’s in-house copywriter and content editor.
154e7442-e4da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: John Zeratsky

15f7d0a5-fee0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Evan Rapoport is a Product Manager for Google Maps on community photography products, including Views and Photo Sphere. He loves pushing the limits of what smart phone cameras can do, and creating products that empower people to share their adventures through pictures and maps. Before joining Google in 2011, he lived in Honolulu, Hawaii where he worked on adventure travel storytelling, educational products for oceanography and environmental stewardship, and brain-computer interfaces for severely disabled people. Evan also loves hiking, stand-up paddling, and the ocean.
15f7d0a5-fee0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Evan Rapoport

16f401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Alex is a Software Engineer working in the Chrome and Blink teams. In the past several years he has contributed to the creation of Web Components, Service Workers, and Google Chrome Frame.

Alex serves as a member of the W3C's Technical Architecture Group which reviews and shapes the design of new web platform features to ensure that they are coherent and create an integrated, layered whole. He is one of the authors of the Extensible Web Manifesto: http://extensiblewebmanifesto.org/. Alex also serves on ECMA TC39, the standards committee for JavaScript where he has helped champion the addition of features like Promises and Classes for the next version of the language (ES6).

Prior to joining Google, Alex worked on large-scale JavaScript frameworks and the sorts of rich client-side apps that require them.
16f401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Russell

19b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Lajos is the tech lead on the Android video framework team.  Combining his love of gadgets, music, multimedia and people, he is passionate about enabling developers to create spectacular multimedia experiences on the Android platform.
19b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Lajos Molnar

1c408a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Ankur is a Developer Advocate experienced in building for Android, Maps and Google Cast. He enjoys supporting developers in building innovative, scalable and performant apps. Ankur is also the Mobile Technical Lead for Google Santa Tracker where he loves spreading holiday cheer.
1c408a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ankur Kotwal

21b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Olly is a member of the Android team. He's played a part developing both YouTube and Play Movies for Android, leads development of ExoPlayer, and has a keen interest in improving video playback across the whole Android ecosystem. Prior to joining Google, Olly completed a Ph.D. at the University of Cambridge.
21b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Oliver Woodman

21cb32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Eddy is the tech lead for Android's camera framework team, which is responsible for Android's camera API and camera hardware abstraction layer.
Prior to working at Android, he completed a doctorate in electrical engineering at Stanford University, focusing on programmable digital cameras and computational photography.
21cb32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Eddy Talvala

2281837c-94d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jonathan Bingham is Product Manager of Google Genomics and leads Google’s efforts to support cloud computing for the life sciences. Previously he was Product Manager at Pacific Biosciences and a bioinformatician at Sugen, a Pharmacia Company, where he mined genomic data to identify kinases and phosphatases, and Los Alamos National Laboratory, where he developed algorithms and pipelines for viral evolution. He holds a dual MBA from Columbia University and University of California Berkeley and was a PhD candidate at Duke University before leaving to start two businesses. When traveling in the Bay Area, ask him for international restaurant recommendations.
2281837c-94d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jonathan Bingham

22d276c7-19fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Ficus was a founding member of the Android team, and currently leads the Google Play Store, Apps, Games, and Devices teams.
22d276c7-19fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Ficus Kirkpatrick

237ea5e6-d7f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: For the last 22 years, and after earning his Ph.D. in cognitive psychology and user interface design, building innovative, top-of-the-line UX solutions and applications has been his passion. Before becoming an independent consultant, he co-founded two companies: the largest company in Israel for UX design (UI Ltd.) and Applied Cognitive Engineering, Ltd. (ACE) for cognitive training. Currently, in addition to his work as strategic UX consultant, he coordinates the UX activity for Campus TLV Launchpad, an acceleration program for startups, managed by Google in Tel Aviv and lecture at events across the globe.
237ea5e6-d7f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Jacob Greenshpan

23f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: As a senior interaction designer on the Android team, Dave has contributed to Android Gmail, Android Email, Android System design and cross-product design efforts across Google. Previously, Dave worked at frog design where he developed product and service ecosystems for a variety of clients. Dave holds a Masters in Interaction Design from Interaction Ivrea.
23f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Dave Chiu

249629a7-b6da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan is a product guy who loves working on things that make ops easier.  Prior to Google, Dan was one of the founders of Stackdriver, a provider of "intelligent" monitoring services for cloud-powered applications.
249629a7-b6da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Daniel Belcher

26408a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: As a Developer Advocate, Dan Galpin has spent the last four years at Google working with the Play and Android teams around gaming technologies and directly with developers as they bring their vision of gaming to Android.
26408a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Galpin

26f401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: As a webmaster trends analyst, Pierre follows industry trends in SEO and web development in order to help different Google teams build better tools for webmasters and improve search quality. Pierre also writes for the Webmaster Central Blog and participates in Google and external forums, helping site owners troubleshoot search-related problems and get the most out of Google Webmaster Tools.
26f401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Pierre Far

29b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Designer on the Android Wear team. I've been designing and building wearable computing prototypes for several years, and previously worked on Google's search products. Originally from Ireland, now living with my wife and son in San Francisco.
29b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Emmet Connolly

2bf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Bethany Fong is a user experience designer for Android and a member of a cross-functional team that shapes design across Google. She's contributed to Android system design, Android@Home, and Accessibility. Bethany studied Product Design and Engineering at Stanford University.
2bf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Bethany Fong

2c2e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Research scientist and team lead for physical interaction research at Google. Our concepts use the rich sensors of consumer devices -- such as cameras, microphones and motion sensors -- to make user interaction more direct, intuitive and enjoyable. After receiving my PhD in Computer Science from Freiburg University, Germany, I joined the Stanford AI Lab for a postdoc and co-founded Numovis Inc., a tech startup focused on motion tracking and computer vision for user interaction.
2c2e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Christian Plagemann

2c7569c5-f7d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: The passion for design has led Gus to experience different aspects of the design process. From Online Advertising in Germany; to Broadcast Design in Italy; to Interactive Video Production in Brazil. Joined Google UK in 2012 and is currently working with the Android team in Mountain View, juggling between wearable computing efforts and a newborn baby!
2c7569c5-f7d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Gustavo Sonoda

2d6849ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Meghan Desai is a Product Manager at Google working on Android power management and wireless connectivity features. He has previously worked on Google’s Big Data platform. He is passionate about building products that are simple, seamless, and intuitive to use. An engineer at heart, Meghan enjoys building Android apps, tinkering with microcontrollers, and studying oenology. He has a BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
2d6849ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Meghan Desai

2eb02d78-2afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Amir Shevat is the global Startup Outreach lead in Google Developer Relations (g.co/launch). Previously, Amir Led Google Campus Tel Aviv and was the co founder of several startups.
2eb02d78-2afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Amir Shevat

2ef401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Ilya Grigorik is a web performance engineer and developer advocate at Google, where his focus is on making the web fast and driving adoption of performance best practices.
2ef401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ilya Grigorik

312ac6f1-f4cf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Chris Ramsdale is a product manager for the Google Cloud Platform where he is focused on managed compute and data services.  Chris’ mission is to use the benefits of cloud computing to drive developer productivity and happiness.  Prior to joining Google, Chris worked extensively in the mobile space, starting as a Software Engineer at Motorola in 1997, and then joining local start ups as a Tech Lead and Product Manager building developers tools and platforms.
312ac6f1-f4cf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Chris Ramsdale

31b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Sugu works on site scalability projects at the YouTube infrastructure & storage team. He's currently focused on developing Vitess. Prior to YouTube, he was part of the architecture team at PayPal. He has also done work in development environments, compilers, and computer graphics. Sugu has been writing go code since 2010.
31b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Sugu Sougoumarane

327bf533-6ddc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Lara Swanson is the Engineering Manager of Performance at Etsy. She champions page load time, experiment-driven design, and delivering a consistent experience to screens of all sizes.
327bf533-6ddc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Lara Swanson

337385ff-34cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Matthew leads the Polymer team, which is part of the Chrome team at Google. Prior to joining Google, he was responsible for the Enyo framework, Ares development environment, and SDK at webOS.
337385ff-34cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Matt McNulty

33e3e929-1afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Dave Burke is Engineering Director for the Android platform and Nexus devices.
33e3e929-1afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Dave Burke

3473f32d-9df5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Eric is the founding CTO of One Degree, a nonprofit working to revolutionize the way low-income families access social services. Eric came to the organization to continue his work in applying technology to improve the lives of underserved people in need. Prior to joining, Eric was a product manager and engineer at Change.org, which powers social justice campaigns around the world. Previously, Eric consulted at M+R Strategic Services, working for nonprofits in the public interest, running online advocacy and fundraising efforts. Eric has a BA in Computer Science from Goucher College, and has been a software engineer elsewhere, building web and desktop applications for the social sector.
3473f32d-9df5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Eric Lukoff

352d9c71-edcf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Since 1998, I have been called a consultant, contractor, web developer, CEO, CTO, cofounder, software engineer, presenter, author and occasionally other names that an unusual burst of good taste prevents me from mentioning here.

In all of these roles I have endeavored to cultivate technical mastery, integrity, humility and a sense of humor while continuing to be straightforward and plainspoken. I am, after all, the grandson of a West Virginia coal miner.

These days, I lead the amazing engineers on the HTML5 TV team at YouTube. We are using web technologies to develop rich, interactive experiences on a huge variety of different hardware platforms for millions of YouTube viewers.

While I was originally raised by alligators in the Gulf Coast swamps of St. Petersburg, Florida, I have lived all over the San Francisco Bay Area since 1997. 

These days I make my home near the southernmost edge of San Francisco in the never-ending winter of Bernal Heights.
352d9c71-edcf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Luke Bayes

356849ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: James is a Product Manager on the Android team, he's worked on the video, audio & graphics frameworks and now works on enterprise. Before joining Android James was a Product Manager on Google Maps and launched Google Fiber.
356849ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: James Kelly

390c3dfc-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Toby is an engineering manager working on Google's cloud platform, with a focus on using logging, monitoring and alerting to make developers on the Google cloud products happier and more productive. Prior to his current cloud efforts, Toby worked on Google's internal infrastructure, and was a distributed systems engineer at NetApp, Laurel Networks and FORE Systems.
390c3dfc-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Toby Smith

3b058269-becf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Megan is the Product Manager for both the Google Maps for Android API v2 and the Google Maps for iOS SDK.
3b058269-becf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Megan  Boundey

3b0644f4-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Francis Ma is the lead Product Manager of the Google+ Platform team.  Prior to Google, he was a startup co-founder and a software developer.  Aside from building products and tinkering with gadgets, Francis loves playing ice hockey.
3b0644f4-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Francis Ma

3b1bf2b5-cfda-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: David M. Hogue, Ph.D. is a UX Designer, Manager of the Google Travel UX team, and an Applied Psychologist with more than 15 years experience. He combines his UX design, research, and psychology skills to bring deeper insight into user behavior, uncover strategic opportunities for innovation, and to solve challenging UX problems. Dave also teaches UX and interaction design courses at SFSU and applied psychology in the graduate program at GGU.
3b1bf2b5-cfda-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Dave Hogue

3bf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Christian Robertson leads the visual design effort for Android. He is also the designer of the Roboto type family.
3bf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Christian Robertson

3c2e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: As part of the Dart team I am working on making Dart the obvious choice for server side development. This includes focus on supporting Google infrastructure and services with Dart. Before working on Dart I have worked on Googles JavaScript engine V8 being the main responsible for the debugger.
3c2e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Søren Gjesse

3ef401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Pete loves the open web and sorely misses the blink tag.
3ef401d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Pete LePage

41058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Pratip is a product manager on the Google Play for Education team, where is he responsible for the Play for Education storefront and content. At Google, he's also worked within the Google Play digital publishing group, on products like Play Books and Play Newsstand. Prior to joining Google, Pratip was a product manager at Akamai and a management consultant at Bain & Company.
41058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Pratip Banerji

430644f4-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jennifer is the Technical Lead Manager for the Google+ Platform. The Platform team helps users bring their Google experience with them across the internet, and the best of their internet experience back to Google.
430644f4-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer W. Lin

44f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Rachel is a Senior Designer on the Google Play team and leading imagery direction at Google.
44f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Rachel Been

48c989a3-45d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Ian is a member of the Android Runtime Team (ART). He holds a PhD, M.Phil and B.Sc from the University of Manchester, UK. He is a fellow of the British Computer Society and ACM SIGPLAN award winner. Ian is an expert in the areas of managed runtimes, concurrent garbage collectors, compilers and binary translators.
48c989a3-45d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ian Rogers

49b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Android Wear Software Engineer. I enjoy bringing Android to new form factors so developers can build apps that are ubiquitous and useful.
49b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Justin Koh

4bc8c293-d7f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Amy Wu  is a Product Manager focused on creating a great Google Play storefront. Prior to Google Play she spent years on search and advertising at Google.
4bc8c293-d7f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Amy Wu

4c2e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Driving open web media forward with Chrome Media and the WebM project.
4c2e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Renganathan Ramamoorthy

51058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Lewis Leiboh works on the Google Play for Education team, focused on getting amazing Android apps from the vibrant educational technology community into the hands of teachers and students.

Before joining Google, Lewis headed up Teach For America's national team focused on educational technology and data systems initiatives. He spent ten years with Teach For America, including as a middle school math teacher.

Lewis thinks technology can play an important role in the incredibly hard work to improve academic achievement and put students on a different life path.
51058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Lewis Leiboh

51f6483d-1afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Dr. Jhilmil Jain is the head of user research at Android. She is passionate about leading teams that execute research and design to shape the product strategy and definition. Earlier in her 10-year career in Silicon Valley, she worked at Microsoft, HP Research Labs and IBM Almaden Research Lab in domains such as mobile platforms, TV, retail, gaming etc. Jhilmil is a known expert in the field - she consistently presents and has held leadership positions at conferences like CHI, HCII, UXPA and holds several patents in information visualization and personal information management systems. When Jhilmil is not focused on growing Android internationally and defining the future of computing, she can be found volunteering at Girls Who Code, Humane Society of Silicon Valley, and agility teaching her dog.
51f6483d-1afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Jhilmil Jain

52162a4a-7de6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Ekaterina Volkova is a Software Engineer working on Google Cloud Platform. She leads container integration for the App Engine SDK.
52162a4a-7de6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Kate  Volkova

52b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan Aminzade is a software engineer on the Android Wear team.
52b751fa-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Aminzade
