542e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Colt McAnlis is a Developer Advocate at Google focusing on Games and Performance; Before that, he was a graphics programmer in the games industry working at Blizzard, Microsoft (Ensemble), Petroglyph, and an Adjunct Professor at SMU Guildhall. Recently, he’s a UDACITY course instructor on HTML5 games and a Book Author. When he's not working with developers, Colt spends his time preparing for an invasion of giant ants from outer space.
542e19dc-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Colt McAnlis

54f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Hannah Cho is a visual designer for Android UX team.  She finds delight in bringing print-like design language into Android and believes that visual design can further impact and improve the Android user experience.
54f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Hannah Cho

55192992-4ed1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Brad Nelson is a Software Engineer at Google focusing on Developer Tools, Browser Performance, and Security.
Brad has a bachelors degree from Caltech and a masters from Stanford University.
55192992-4ed1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Bradley Nelson

563cfcac-01da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jatin is an Android framework developer who is passionate about enabling seamless transition of users between devices. Over last few years working on Android he has gained wide experience ranging from authentication, security, cloud messaging and cloud storage. He as worked at Google for last 6 years and in his past life has worked on building scalable backends for Google Search Quality human rating platform.
563cfcac-01da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jatin Lodhia

59058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Brahim is a Product Manager at Google Play responsible for commerce, search, and discovery.  Brahim works on features such as the Google Play purchase experience and integration of new forms of payment such as PayPal.  Brahim holds an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a BS in Computer Science and Engineering from UCLA. Brahim has also worked at Amazon and Deloitte in addition to starting a company in the past.
59058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Brahim Elbouchikhi

59415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Anwar Ghuloum is Engineering Manager for Android's Runtimes & Tools team at Google.  Prior to joining Google, Anwar was Director of Mobile Compute and Computer Vision at Nvidia, a Principal Engineer at Intel in the role of Chief Architect and Product Development Manager for Intel Array Building Blocks (formerly called Ct) in Intel Labs and the Software and Services Group, and a co-founder in a digital imaging chip startup and developed drug design software using 3D object recognition algorithms. Anwar holds a B.Sci. from UCLA  and a Ph.D. from Carnegie Mellon University, both in Computer Science.
59415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Anwar Ghuloum

59f963be-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jordan Tigani has more than 15 years of professional software development experience, the last 4 of which have been spent building BigQuery. Prior to joining Google, Jordan worked at a number of star-crossed startups, where he learned to make data-based predictions. He is a co-author of Google BigQuery Analytics, and plays soccer for several recreational teams in Seattle.
59f963be-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jordan Tigani

5aed889b-d1da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Mamie is a Program Manager in Developer Relations who designs experiences, communities and environments for grassroots innovation. She first joined Google in May 2006 after receiving her B.A. in Urban Studies from Stanford University. While on the Google Labs team, she co-created The Garage, Google's hacker, maker, design space. Shifting her focus from Google's internal Engineering culture, she now supports the global community of developers, designers and entrepreneurs who are building meaningful and magical experiences for Google Glass.
5aed889b-d1da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Mamie Rheingold

5b96a23e-19fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Rachel leads interaction design for the Android system on phones and tablets. Earlier in her time on Android, she co-authored Android's design principles and contributed to the launch of the Android Design Guide. Before joining Google in 2005, she worked at TiVo, AOL, and several startups.
5b96a23e-19fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Rachel Garb

5c259936-d6f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Eyal Rabinovich manages the world-wide marketing and business development activities in PlayScape, a leading mobile game publisher. As an entrepreneur with extensive experience in developing and marketing consumer-facing products, he works with game developers to distribute and commercialize their games. Before founding PlayScape Eyal served as an officer in an elite IDF Navy unit, in addition to being a Senior Software Engineer at Hedge-Tech Financial Engineering, and Lipman Electronic Engineering Ltd.
5c259936-d6f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Eyal Rabinovich

5cf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Zachary Gibson is a Senior Designer at Google working on cross product visual and interaction design with UXA.
5cf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Zachary Gibson

605f7534-95db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Yoky Matsuoka is Vice President of Technology at Nest, where she leads the development of the learning and control technology for the Nest thermostat and smoke detector. Previously, Yoky served as the Head of Innovation at Google and Professor of Computer Science and Engineering at the University of Washington. She graduated from UC Berkeley and earned an MS and PhD in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from MIT. She has also received the MacArthur Genius Award for her work in robotics and neuroscience.
605f7534-95db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Yoky Matsuoka

60a7e520-efdc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Rachad leads Android Media framework, the group responsible for building Android’s Audio, Video, DRM and Camera infrastructure. He was formerly Chief Technology Officer at Bluestreak Technology where he led the development of HTML5 and Flash video technologies for embedded platforms. He contributed to the development of the very first Digital TV middlewares (OpenTV) and PVR platforms (TiVo).
60a7e520-efdc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Rachad Alao

61058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Bob leads games business development for Google Play. He focuses on growing Google Play game developer revenue, managing new initiative outreach, and influencing product development of key features including payments and discovery/ distribution.
61058c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Bob Meese

668b5089-60d5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Dennis Huo's team, as part of Google Cloud Platform, is responsible for ensuring seamless interoperability and data portability between the many open-source Big Data technologies within the Hadoop ecosystem and Google Cloud Platform services. Prior to Cloud, Dennis worked in Search Infrastructure, helping to build Google's next-generation instant indexing technology. With his experience working intimately with Google's internal infrastructure, Dennis is passionate about helping users harness the best of both the vibrant open-source Big Data ecosystem and Google's Cloud Platform offerings. Dennis has a BS in Computer Science and minors in Math and Electrical Engineering from the University of Rochester.
668b5089-60d5-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Dennis Huo

66a70be7-5af2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Puneet is the program lead for Solve for X (www.solveforx.com) - an open moonshot platform powered by Google [x].  She discovers and attracts individuals and organizations working on tech moonshots and uses the convening power of Google to accelerate their progress.  Before joining Google she was an Analyst at Goldman Sachs, focused on picking structurally-advantaged companies that have the potential to disrupt their industries over the coming two decades.  She served on the Board of Directors for Colin Powell's non-profit - America's Promise, co-founded an NGO called Freedom's Answer, and co-authored a book under the same title.  Puneet received her BSc and MA from Oxford University.
66a70be7-5af2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Puneet Ahira

6a281ffa-cccb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Majd runs the engineering team in charge of Cast and Chromecast. Majd joined Google in 2011 and was focused on solving the 10' interaction model for large screens. Prior to joining Google Majd was the lead architect for Microsoft Mediaroom.
6a281ffa-cccb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Majd Bakar

6bf794fe-d3cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Adam is a software engineer on the Android framework team.
6bf794fe-d3cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Adam Powell

6d021371-a2d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Rouslan works on payments, addresses, and spellcheck in Chrome.
6d021371-a2d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Rouslan Solomakhin

6f4c65bc-aacc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Been working on the Android cloud team for a little over one year. Started out on the provisioning team - OTAs, release cycle, all that fun stuff. Eventually took over the SyncManager framework, and now I'm focusing entirely on client side - both in Google Play Services and the platform, with an emphasis on network usage.
6f4c65bc-aacc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Matthew Williams

701054fb-c7cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Zeina Oweis is a Product Manager on the Google Play Commerce and Monetization team. She is responsible for both Consumer and Developer facing subscription features. Zeina is a graduate of Harvard College, and had worked at LinkedIn prior to joining Google.
701054fb-c7cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Zeina Oweis

71250b31-41d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jennifer King leads the engineering team developing the Drive Android API. The team's mission is to make it easy for developers to create and access files stored in the cloud via Google Drive.
71250b31-41d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer  King

71415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jason Douglas is Group Product Manager for the Knowledge Graph platform.  He has also been involved with schema.org since its inception and has been working on the problems of information aggregation and syndication for nearly 20 years -- including at PointCast, Grand Central Networks, My Yahoo!, and Freebase (Metaweb), which was acquired by Google in 2010.
71415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jason Douglas

753b7e48-a8cc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: JF is a senior software engineer on Google's Portable Native Client. He brings fast, secure and simple native code to the Web platform. Before dorking out on systems and compilers he dealt with dynamic binary translation, CPU design, flight simulators, business jets, and startup incubators.
753b7e48-a8cc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: JF Bastien

755d9e72-cad0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Annette has been with Google since 2012, where she currently works as a Sr. Designer on Google Maps. She brings projects from development through to completion, defines user interface for new and existing products and features, develops high level mockups, motion graphics and prototypes, to effectively communicate interaction and visual design ideas. She has experience integrating design across multiple platforms, from desktop, mobile, TV, and gaming consoles.
755d9e72-cad0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Annette Leong

7a80215f-95db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Gabriella Levine is an artist and hardware designer interested in the relationship between technology and ecology. She creates sculptural and robotic works that mimic environmental phenomena and animal behavior. She studied Biology and Piano at Cornell University and Oberlin College, then worked doing Cancer Research at Albert Einstein College of Medicine before abandoning the lab for the outdoors to become a wildland fire-fighter based in Oregon. She holds a Masters degree in Design and Technology from ITP, Tisch School of the Arts, NYU. She is President of OSHWA (Open Source Hardware Association), and recently joined Google[x] on the Rapid Eval team.
7a80215f-95db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Gabriella Levine

7c2d07ef-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jon has been at Google since 2006, where he currently serves as Principal Designer for Google Search and Maps. Jon was the first designer for Google Autocomplete, was the instigator for Google Instant, and led the Search UX team through three redesigns and the addition of new features such as the Knowledge Graph and voice search. In his current role Jon works to define, develop, and direct a vision of where Google Search and Maps should go in order to deliver a simple, useful, and beautiful experience.
7c2d07ef-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jon Wiley

7c539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Steve is a media streaming engineer working to annihilate buffering and deliver crystal-clear video for all YouTube playbacks.
7c539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Steven Robertson

7c74bb5a-78d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Visual Designer at Google Play. Teddy design involve a large part of the Play visual design like the Store, Music and the Play brand system.
He used to work for Nokia, Squarespace and SumAll. Music addicted, comics reader, gamer and a fan photographer.
7c74bb5a-78d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Taddeo Zacchini

7cde3b93-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: In 2011 Felipe Hoffa move from Chile to San Francisco to join Google as a Software Engineer. Since 2013 he's been a Developer Advocate on big data - to inspire developers around the world to leverage the Google Cloud Platform tools to analyze and understand their data in ways they could never before. You can find him in several YouTube videos, blog posts, and conferences around the world.
7cde3b93-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Felipe Hoffa

7d5a673f-c4cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Mark McBride is services engineer lead at Nest Labs, creator of the Nest Learning Thermostat and Nest Protect: Smoke + Carbon Monoxide Alarm. Mark is responsible for the development of Nest’s server infrastructure, which makes it possible for Nest customers to connect with their homes from wherever they are.
 
Prior to Nest, Mark was an early developer on Twitter's streaming API, delivering thousands of messages per second in real time to millions of users. He also managed developer productivity and led the web delivery, developer tools and infrastructure test teams during his time at Twitter. Mark also held engineering management positions at both EMC and Luminate. He earned his MBA degree from the University of California, Berkeley, and his BS degrees in electrical engineering and computer science from the University of California, Davis.
7d5a673f-c4cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Mark McBride

7f055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jenny Gove is a User Experience Researcher at Google, where she conducts research on smartphone and tablet use. Previously Jenny managed the Apps, Social, and the Ads Design Research teams at Google, conducted research at Sun Microsystems, and created interaction designs at a start­up, Zadu. Jenny started her career in academia, and was a Lecturer at the Open University, UK, where she conducted Educational Technology research. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Southampton in the UK.
7f055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer Gove

7fe4044a-acf5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio:
Stefan is a founding member of the Technology Advisory Board for Beyond 12, a nonprofit created 
to increase the number of traditionally underserved students who earn a college degree. Among other things, Stefan is supporting the development of Beyond 12’s mobile app, MyCoach, which helps low-income students navigate the path to college and stay on track once they arrive, significantly enhancing graduation rates. He is currently a director at Slalom Digital, focusing on creating digital experiences for Fortune 500 companies. Stefan has been leading teams that build software for close to 15 years across various industries. Prior to Slalom, Stefan helped bring solutions to life with teams at Dell and helped launch several companies, including Explorica, an innovator and leader in the group travel industry, as well as Just-In-Time, an early innovator in the team collaboration and communications space.
7fe4044a-acf5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Stefan Nilsson

808084f3-22db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Nazmul is an developer & designer focused on creating awesome user experiences powered by Android & Cloud developer technologies. He is passionate about UX engineering, the design process, mobile computing, cloud computing, startups, and innovation. He created the UXD for Developers show on the Android Developers Channel on YouTube, started the UXD for Developers G+ community.
808084f3-22db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Nazmul Idris

81415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Tim has been at Google since 2007, working on a wide range of projects including search, Google Play, and Android.
81415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Tim Kilbourn

81a88f73-d6f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Aaron Harris was cofounder of Tutorspree, which was funded by Y Combinator in 2011. Before Tutorspree he worked at Bridgewater Associates, where he managed product and operations for an analytics group. He has an AB in History and Literature from Harvard.
81a88f73-d6f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Aaron Harris

84f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Marwa Mabrouk is a Product Manager at Google. Marwa focuses on bringing Google’s capabilities in Cloud Computing and Big Data to Google Cloud Platform users. Before joining Google, Marwa has dedicated her time and attention to furthering new frontiers for spatial analysis. She led the development of the first hosted web services in the industry to offer maps online, as well as leading the development of the first managed services for spatial analysis in the cloud. She has been a strong evangelist of Cloud Computing and Big Data during the last few years, and continues to work towards wider usability of Big Data technologies in the Cloud.
84f17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Marwa Mabrouk

85f4ba94-45d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Brian Carlstrom is a member of the Android Runtime Team (ART).  Prior
to joining Google, Brian was at Stanford University where his research
focused on programming language design and implementation for hardware
transactional memory. Previously, Brian was on the first engineering
team at e-procurement startup Ariba where he was later product and
platform architect. Earlier Brian was a software engineer at ecommerce
startup Open Market and mobile device startup General Magic. Brian
holds a PhD and MS in computer science from Stanford University and an
MEng and SB in electrical engineering and computer science from the
Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
85f4ba94-45d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Brian  Carlstrom

87055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Greg is the User Experience Lead for the AdWords Platform of products.  In his spare time, he likes to play drums and with his kids (but not at the same time).
87055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Greg Rosenberg

89415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Paul Irish is a Developer Advocate for the Web at Google. He wants to make you more productive with tools to help you make slicker, sexier, mobile web apps. He works on the Chrome DevTools, Chrome's web platform and open source projects like Modernizr, Yeoman, and other things that improve the web.
89415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Irish

8cd12c4e-cded-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Leo is a senior designer on the Android Design team. Currently he is working on extending Android to new form factors. In his time at Google he has lead projects within Chromecast, Google TV, and more.
8cd12c4e-cded-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Leo Baghdassarian

8cf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: William Vambenepe leads the Product Management team for Big Data on Google Cloud Platform.
8cf17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: William Vambenepe

90055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex Faaborg is the design lead for Android Wear at Google. Since joining Google, he has overseen the design of Google Now, the Android OS on the Nexus 5, and he has contributed to the timeline interface of Google Glass. Prior to joining Google, Alex served at Mozilla as the principal designer on Firefox for five years. Much of Alex’s innovative work in the technology industry comes from his experience in academia: at the MIT Media Lab he researched artificial intelligence, intelligent agents, and context aware computing. Alex’s interactive design work is based on fundamentals of human cognition and perception, from his background in Cognitive Science.
90055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Faaborg

912d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Justin Uberti is one of the co-creators of the WebRTC project, and leads the WebRTC engineering team at Google. Previously, Justin helped create Google+ Hangouts.
912d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Justin Uberti

916fa237-f6d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Ari is a senior designer and manager on the Android Design team, contributing to cross-functional efforts within Android and across Google. Prior to joining Google, he worked in a wide range of areas including projection design for theater, film title design and motion graphics, and visual effects for film and special venues.
916fa237-f6d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ari Sachter-Zeltzer

917b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Michael is the tech lead on the Google team working on mobile payments. He is also a co-author of the book "Android in Practice."
917b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Michael Galpin

94539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex is a Developer Advocate for Chrome at Google. He has been involved with W3C web standardization for over a decade. Prior to Google, he was an architect and team leader for web engine implementations that focused on high performance, mobile and embedded devices.
94539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Danilo

94b410a4-35cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Google Software Engineer working on AdWords Frontend. Contributing and coding with Dart since it's beginnings. Contributor to Angular.dart, mondo_dart wrappers, fukiya, formler, web-ui (now deprecated.)

Avid bicyclist, soccer & golf player, hockey and baseball enthusiast. Born and raised in the Silicon Valley.
94b410a4-35cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ted Sander

976f1e53-9df5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio:
Susan is the CEO of Hack the Hood -- a nonprofit addressing digital equity by training low-income 
kids to build websites for local small businesses, actively supporting them to launch their own tech 
careers. She also co-founded Oakland Local, a news hub for Oakland and Live Work Oakland, a 
tech & business innovation news site. In her corporate life, she was VP of Network Development at 
Netscape and America Online, and Senior Director of Product and Revenue Optimization at Yahoo! 
She was the founder of a TechStars incubator company and launched Code for Oakland, a 
tech event focused on building apps to serve the Oakland community.
976f1e53-9df5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Susan Mernit

97c0957f-35fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: With over eight years of marketing, public relations and business development experience in the interactive entertainment and technology industries, Mel has amassed over 60 project credits covering all major gaming platforms. Project credits include Pinball FX2, Zen Pinball, Guitar Hero, Guitar Hero II, Jackass: The Game, Star Trek Online, and PhysX by Ageia. Kirk has a solid history of building brands and selling product. Mel joined Zen Studios as Vice President of Marketing and Public Relations for Zen Studios in the summer of 2010. When not working he can be found on the ski slopes of the Sierra Nevada’s, lounging on a beach, or playing Mario Kart with his daughters.
97c0957f-35fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Mel Kirk

9a86ea7d-37cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Interface technology guru. Core-contributor to Kinetic. Wiimotes TED talker. YouTube watch = 15M. Technology Review TR35. Carnegie Mellon PhD.  Now, Project Tango Lead trying to make the future awesome.
9a86ea7d-37cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Johnny Lee

9c539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jen is a Product Manager on the Google Maps team. She loves building apps and making tools for developers.
9c539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jen Kovnats

9df17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Manfred is an Associate Product Manager on the Cloud Platform team, working on enabling great Cloud+Android interactions, and making developers' lives easier with Google Cloud SDK. Manfred holds Computer Science degrees from Cambridge and Oxford, and prior to joining Google worked on productivity software at Microsoft.
9df17e12-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Manfred Zabarauskas

a1415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Braden Kowitz is a product designer, prototyper, and storyteller. He's also a Design Partner at Google Ventures and founded the team's Design Studio. He advises startups on UX Design and Product Development. Before joining Google Ventures, Braden led design for several Google Products, including Gmail, Google Buzz, Google Apps for Business, Google Spreadsheets, OpenSocial, and Google Trends.
a1415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Braden Kowitz

a19e9425-4ff7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Artist from a family of Artists. Animator and master draftsman. Champion of the hand-drawn line. Storyteller. Disney Legend. Creator of Ariel, Beast, Aladdin, Pocahontas, Tarzan, Rapunzel. Creator of Google ATAP's upcoming Spotlight Story, "Duet".
a19e9425-4ff7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Glen Keane

a1c9aeeb-dbcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Tomas Isdal has been a Software Engineer with Google Cloud Platform since 2012. He is currently the Tech Lead for Managed VMs. Prior to joining Google, Tomas was the founder at a small startup where he experienced Google Cloud from a customer perspective. Tomas has a PhD from the University of Washington, his dissertation focused on privacy and performance of p2p and distributed systems.
a1c9aeeb-dbcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Tomas Isdal

a32d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Tomer Sharon is a Senior User Experience Researcher at Google Search in New York City. He is the author of the book, "Lean User Research for Product Development (Rosenfeld Media, 2015) and, "It’s Our Research" (2012). He is a startup mentor at Google’s Campus in Tel Aviv, Israel. Tomer founded and led the Israeli chapter of the User Experience Professionals' Association. He holds a master’s degree in Human Factors in Information Design from Bentley University in Waltham, MA.
a32d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Tomer Sharon

a9265f38-c9f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Eden Shochat builds stuff, including the Aleph venture capital fund; The Junction, one of the top startup programs in Israel; face.com, a face recognition API acquired by Facebook; Aternity, a user experience monitoring tool; and GeekCon, an annual geek weekend gathering.
a9265f38-c9f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Eden Shochat

a9666e7d-9fe2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Payal has been a Product Manager on the Google Crisis Response team since 2012. She has focused on bringing important public warnings to affected people by driving the adoption of CAP (Common Alerting Protocol) globally, integrating Public Alerts in everyday tools at scale and is actively working on making them accessible through the Public Alerts API. She has also helped lead company-wide responses to disasters such as Hurricane Sandy and Typhoon Yolanda.
Payal has a B.S. in Computer Engineering from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and an M.B.A. from MIT Sloan School of Management.
a9666e7d-9fe2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Payal Patel

aac260f2-bfcf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Justin is the Product Manager for the Places API, which provides developers with local context and data. Originally from New Jersey, Justin attended the University of California, Berkeley, and has then worked at Google in their Bay Area and Sydney, Australia offices. In addition to powering the next generation of contextual apps, his interests lie in tennis, noodles, hiking, sun, and Aussie shiraz.
aac260f2-bfcf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Justin Chu

ac539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Luc Vincent joined Google in 2004. In his 20% time, he helped ramp up the project that became Google Street View and externally launched in 2007. Today, Luc is an engineering director in Google's Geo group and is responsible for delivering amazing imagery experiences to Google users around the world.
ac539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Luc Vincent

ad7d2a0a-c3cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Greg Hartrell is the lead product manager for Google Play Games: Google's game platform that helps developers reach and unite millions of players. In his spare time, he enjoys flying birds through plumbing structures, boss battles and pulling rare objects from mystery boxes.
ad7d2a0a-c3cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Greg Hartrell

afb30576-a1cc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Based in London, UK, Mandy is a Developer Advocate at Google specializing in Cloud technologies. One of her main aims in life is to make the world a better place for developers building applications for the Cloud. In the past year she has presented at over 30 events, including two Cloud Developer Platform Roadshow tours and large developer events such as JFokus, PHP UK and Velocity. In her spare time Mandy is learning Japanese and likes to play the guitar.
afb30576-a1cc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Mandy Waite

b1415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Prakash Hariramani is a senior product manager in the Google Wallet team. His mission is to make the mobile commerce and checkout process fast and easy for developers and merchants selling physical goods & services through Google Wallet Instant Buy.
Prakash started his career in financial services and then moved to mobile and then decided to combine the two. Prakash has a Bachelor's degree from Franklin & Marshall College and a Master of Science from Carnegie Mellon University
b1415506-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Prakash Hariramani

b42c5c84-d6cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Amin Shaikh is an engineer working on the Google Glass voice platform team.
b42c5c84-d6cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Amin Shaikh

b42d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
I am an engineer on the Android UI Toolkit team, working on graphics, animations, UI widgets, and performance. I eventually get around to recording DevBytes tutorials on these topics. In the meantime, you can also find me online co-hosting the new Android Developers Backstage podcast.
I've written programming and comedy books and enjoy giving presentations at developer events. Like this one.
b42d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Chet Haase

b43f8a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Craig is a Product Manager working on the Google Cloud Platform.  He was the original product lead for Google Compute Engine, and now works on making more of Google's technical infrastructure available to developers.
b43f8a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Craig McLuckie

b4539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Ben is Google’s Chief Information Officer, overseeing the technical systems that make Googlers go. His experience includes stints as a dBASE II programmer, front-line support manager, Macintosh developer, Windows 1.0 programmer, and Unix systems programmer. Prior to Google, he led development of a mission scheduling system for NASA’s orbital observatories, and later joined Morgan Stanley. Over more than 13 years, he rose to the level of Managing Director, leading teams responsible for software development, web and electronic commerce and operations, and technologies for knowledge workers.

Ben is a graduate of Columbia University.
b4539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ben Fried

b58870d0-d6f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Fadi  is a startup venture advisor and investor with 20 years experience advising entrepreneurs and matching human capital with venture capital across the globe. He  is the Founder & CEO of Blackbox, an accelerator based in Palo Alto, CA empowering born global startups with Silicon Valley resources. Fadi is a sought after speaker and mentor to multiple international startup programs around. Previously, as Founder & CEO of techVenture, Fadi helped build core teams for SV early-stage technology startups and assisted 43 startups, of which, 26 have successfully exited.
b58870d0-d6f5-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Fadi Bishara

b5ca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Kirill has been doing professional client-side development over the last decade in a variety of UI toolkits and libraries that spanned Motif, MFC, VB, Ada, Delphi, Swing and SWT. Since 2009 he's been part of the Android team at Google. He has a particular interest in creating polished, responsive and well-behaving, user-facing applications that help the end users achieve their goals quickly and painlessly.
b5ca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Kirill Grouchnikov

b6078904-46d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Daniel ran an agency in Canada, was creative dir at Digg, and founded a company called Milk that was acquired by Google. He now works with Google Ventures' many portfolio companies on their design challenges.
b6078904-46d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Daniel Burka

b7139c80-8de2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Weston is a Product Manager on Google Cloud Platform. He has spent the last 8 years working in developer tools, with a passion for creating great user experiences to help developers get started faster. Today, he spends much of his time creating and improving the on-boarding experiences for the Google Cloud Platform.
b7139c80-8de2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Weston  Hutchins

b9d41600-92d1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Engineer-artist. Doer-dreamer. Scientific coach, mentor, taskmaster, technogeek. Caltech PhD in mechanical engineering. CNN Top 10 Thinker. The Verge 50. Former Director of DARPA. Captain of the ATAP pirate ship. Likes epic sh*t.
b9d41600-92d1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Regina Dugan

baaff579-5aeb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Will is an engineer for Google Play who splits his time between Play Newsstand, core UX frameworks, and product prototyping. He has been developing mobile apps for the last six years – two as an indie dev and four with Google. Before that he worked for Microsoft on Windows and Media Player. If not at the playground with his kids, he's probably playing music in some Seattle basement.
baaff579-5aeb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Will  Kiefer

bb18c433-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Reuven Lax has spent the past seven years helping to shape Google's data processing and analysis strategy. For much of that time he has focused on Google's low-latency, streaming data processing effort, and he's very excited to bring Google's data-processing experience to the world at large. In 2013 he was proud to publish a paper on this effort which can be found at http://http://research.google.com/pubs/pub41378.html. When not at work, Reuven enjoys swing dancing, rock climbing, and exploring new parts of the world.
bb18c433-0fcc-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Reuven Lax

bc11152b-c4cf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: David is a software engineer at Google, working on the platform powering the Google Art Project. Prior to joining Google in 2011, he worked at Aldebaran Robotics doing computer vision.
bc11152b-c4cf-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: David  Coz

bc2d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Romain was until recently the tech lead on the Android 2D rendering pipeline and UI toolkit. He worked on Android from 1.0 to 4.4 and loves helping application developers optimize their applications.
bc2d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Romain Guy

bdca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Marco is the Design Lead for for Google Play and core Android apps. He advocates for Android applications to be beautifully designed and express their brand univoquely and he runs the Beautiful Apps collection on the Play Store.
Prior to Google he worked on a wide range of industries, designing experiences for Nokia, LG Electronics, Siemens VDO and JWT.
bdca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Marco Paglia

bf31e776-c9f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Shabih is currently a Business Development Manager for Google Play Apps where he leads startup and influencer outreach. In this role he helps early stage companies launch, grow, and build sustainable businesses on Google Play. Prior to this he worked on the Mobile Apps Lab and AdMob teams at Google. He began his career at Genentech and holds a B.A. in Operations Research & Management Science from UC Berkeley.
bf31e776-c9f9-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Shabih Rizvi

c17b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Matt Rogers is founder and VP of Engineering at Nest Labs, creator of the Nest Learning Thermostat and Nest Protect: Smoke + Carbon Monoxide Alarm. By applying modern design and technology, Nest aims to revitalize these stagnant - yet very important - industries. Matt is responsible for all product development at Nest, ranging from mechanical design to software to web services, and everything in between. Matt also serves on Nest's board of directors.       

Prior to Nest, Matt was responsible for iPod software development at Apple, from concept to production. He was one of the first engineers on the original iPhone, and involved in the development of 10 generations of iPod, 5 generations of iPhone, and the first iPad. He earned his BS and MS degrees from Carnegie Mellon University.
c17b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Matt Rogers

c2a57dd2-dbcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Melody Meckfessel is an Engineering Director leading the team responsible for developer tooling and infrastructure for our Cloud Platform.  We build highly scalable systems from IDEs to build systems to highly automated test systems to devops tools and finally release and deployment to Google's Cloud.
c2a57dd2-dbcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Melody Meckfessel

c376887b-c9f7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Stephan Somogyi works in security and privacy product management at Google. His remit includes Safe Browsing, Google’s system that protects over a billion users worldwide from malware and phishing; End-To-End, a project to make strong encryption more usable; and a variety of other security and privacy efforts. Stephan is also an Advisor to Google Ventures, and chairs the Privacy and Public Policy Working Group of the FIDO Alliance, which develops open standards for strong authentication.
c376887b-c9f7-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Stephan Somogyi

c5362478-a2e0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Kripa Krishnan is a Technical Program Director at Google and works on the new gTLDs launch and acceptance program. She also heads up Google's Disaster Recovery Program (DiRT) and runs several Privacy and Security initiatives in Google Apps.  Prior to Google, she worked with the Telemedicine Program of Kosovo to set up telemedicine infrastructure and a virtual education network in the region. In a previous life, she ran a theater and performing arts organization in India for several years.
c5362478-a2e0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Kripa Krishnan

c54b852a-35fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Brendan is the founding CEO of Soundwave. Backed by Mark Cuban & ACT Venture Capital, Soundwave is a social music app that has grown to over 1M+ users in 190 countries since launch in summer 2013. Soundwave allows users to capture all the songs they listen to on Spotify, YouTube and everywhere else and display them on their Soundwave profile for friends to see making Soundwave a “digital watercooler” where people can converge and chat about what they’re listening to.
c54b852a-35fc-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Brendan O’Driskoll

c88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Stephanie Hannon is a Director of Product Management for Social Impact at Google, focused on building innovative technology help people broaden engagement with their community, government and nonprofits. Focus areas range from changing how the world prepares and responds to natural disasters to using data to help cities make evidenced based decisions. She recently transitioned from Facebook where she led product management for Site Integrity and Trust Engineering, working to ensure Facebook is a safe space for communication where people use their authentic identities. Prior to Facebook, Stephanie co-founded an ambitious startup that aimed to bring web innovations, technology and transparency to residential energy management and markets. Stephanie spent seven years as a product manager at Google, most recently as the product lead for Google Wave based in Google's Sydney office. Prior to Sydney she worked in Google's Zurich office, leading the product team for Google Maps for Europe, Middle East and Africa, and before this she was a product manager for Gmail at Google in Mountain View. Stephanie also spent six years as a software engineer building operating systems for the Catalyst line of switches at Cisco Systems after the acquisition of a startup she joined called Granite Systems. Stephanie holds a B.S. Computer Systems Engineering and M.S.E.E. from Stanford University and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School. Stephanie loves traveling (71 countries and counting) and diving with sharks.
c88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Steph Hannon

cbdf8423-33cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Bob is a product designer based in Mountain View, CA. He currently works on the Glass design team.

At Google, he has led the user experience team for Google Glass, Emerging Markets product design, design strategy for YouTube, and interaction design for AdSense.
cbdf8423-33cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Bob Ryskamp

cc539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Corey is an engineer on the Domain Registry team in NYC, and has previously worked on Google Apps Script. Prior to joining Google, Corey earned a PhD in Computer Science at Columbia University, where he researched data-driven techniques for robotic manipulation.
cc539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Corey Goldfeder

cd2d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Paul Bakaus is a Developer Advocate at Google. Prior to joining Google, he created the popular UI framework jQuery UI and later inspired the web community with the Aves Engine, the world's first plugin-less game engine for the web that was later acquired by Zynga. His current mission is to enable every web developer to build rich, immersive and user friendly experiences for the entire screen continuum of devices.
cd2d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Bakaus

cd7e1b45-78d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: 4yr Googler, all spent on Android. Formally worked on the Ice Cream Sandwich & Jellybean framework design, Gmail, People, Email, Camera, as well as launching the first Android Design Style Guide. Spent the last 2 years focused on the Play product family & growing a world-class design team.
cd7e1b45-78d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Nathan Streu

cdca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Arun is an engineer at Google. As part of the Developer Relations team, Arun works closely with Google partners and independent developers to help build compelling applications and services using all of Google technologies. Prior to Google, Arun spent over 9 years at a Boston area company leading a team building a cross-platform mobile application development framework for large enterprises. Arun has a BS in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University. Arun resides in New York City but still loves the outdoors.
cdca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Arun Nagarajan

cdec424d-d3cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Apoorv Saxena is the Product Manager of Google Apps Marketplace and Google Apps platform.
cdec424d-d3cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Apoorv  Saxena

d28bd165-bcd6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: I'm a Developer Programs Engineer specialising in Android, with a focus on enabling the creation of great user interfaces. Previously I worked at various companies creating successful applications.
d28bd165-bcd6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Chris Banes

d4539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Nick Pelly is Technical Lead & Manager of the Automotive Google Maps engineering team based in Sydney. He has a history with Android & connectivity - Nick was part of the team that shipped the original Android G1, before becoming Technical Lead for Bluetooth and then NFC in Android.
d4539724-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Nick Pelly

d52d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Vidya Nagarajan is a Product Manager at Google focusing on Chrome devices for Business and Education. She leads product management for Chrome OS as a kiosk platform to build purpose built devices such as Chromebox for Meetings. She has been at Google for the past 7 years. She first started working on the Google apps for business product line and helped deploy Google apps to some of Google's largest customers such as Genentech and City of Los Angeles.  Vidya holds a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering and a Master of Business Administration degree.
d52d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Vidya Raman Nagarajan

d61523e3-d0da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: With over 15 years in design and innovation, Ratna’s experience encompasses design thinking, user experience, strategy and visioning for consumer products and services in emerging markets for digital, physical and human touchpoints. She has worked in various industries ranging from healthcare, telecom, entertainment, finance and retail to elearning, search and social media to build seamlessly integrated ecosystems across mobile, tablet, desktop and television. Prior to joining Google, Ratna was a Creative Direcor at frog design. Her past work includes engagements with Nike, Disney, Skype, Qualcomm, Sony, PayPal, Chase, AT&T and Gap Inc. With a focus on experience design, branding and product strategy, Ratna’s holistic approach places the user at the center and underscores the importance of storytelling and the context of the culture at large. Not only should design question and offer meaning, but it should always strive to enhance an experience and make it delightful. It's what leads to lasting impressions, preferences, and performance. Ultimately, great design provides a mindset to transform organizations, helping them to reinvent themselves and their products in masterful ways.
d61523e3-d0da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ratna Desai

d84b05fc-d7d7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Jonathan Alferness is currently a Director of Product Management and Global Head of Mobile Ads Products for Google where he oversees product strategy and development for the search, display and app monetization.  Before this he was Director of Search Ads where he focused on Ads Quality, AdSense for Search, Personalization, Optimization and Bidding.  

Jonathan is a 15+ year veteran of the online industry where he has focused on building next generation web technologies, and worked closely with numerous Fortune 500 companies to understand how to embrace the migration to online, and now to mobile.  Jonathan holds a BS degree in Computer Science from Cornell and spent time doing graduate work at Caltech.  He lives in San Francisco, with his wife and two young children.
d84b05fc-d7d7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jonathan Alferness

d88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Eric manages Google's elections and civic engagement products and programs. For the 2012 US elections, his team developed and launched online polling place and ballot information tools that were used over 23 Million times. Eric has also managed the launch of similar services for over 25 elections worldwide, including in India, Kenya, Mexico, Egypt, Germany, and Australia. Eric's team recently launched the Google Civic Information API to make it easier for developers to build useful new civic apps.
d88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Eric Hysen

da055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jonah has been at Google for over 7 years, most recently leading the design of the new Google Maps.  He has a background in design, photography, film, and programming.
da055d00-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jonah Jones

daba42d1-70ec-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Gabriel is a car enthusiast and software engineer on the Android Auto team. He's building beautiful in-car experiences that will make the world a happier place.
daba42d1-70ec-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Gabriel Peal

dbbe1da6-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Matías Duarte leads the Android Design team. He’s responsible for all aspects of the software and visual experience across the Android platform, core applications services, and the design of Nexus tablets and phones.
dbbe1da6-96d4-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Matias Duarte

def301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Eric is a Staff Developer Programs Engineer on the Google Chrome team, working on Polymer and web components. He is the author of “Using the HTML5 Filesystem API” and the lead for html5rocks.com. Prior to Google, Eric worked as a software engineer at the University of Michigan where he designed rich web applications and APIs for the university’s 19 libraries.
def301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Eric Bidelman

e08dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Rebecca Moore is an Engineering Manager at Google, where she initiated and leads the development of Google Earth Engine, a new technology platform that puts an unprecedented amount of satellite imagery online for the first time and enables scientists to conduct global-scale monitoring and measurement of changes in the earth’s environment.  Rebecca also conceived and leads the Google Earth Outreach program, which supports nonprofits, communities and indigenous peoples around the world in applying Google's mapping tools to the world's pressing problems in areas such as environmental conservation, human rights and cultural preservation. Rebecca received a bachelor’s degree with honors from Brown University in Artificial Intelligence and a master’s degree from Stanford University. In 2013, Rebecca was recognized by the White House as a Champion of Change for Open Science.  Her personal work using Google Earth was instrumental in stopping the logging of more than a thousand acres of redwoods in her Santa Cruz Mountain community.
e08dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Rebecca Moore

e27b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Nicholas is a design generalist at Google, leading a group that drives cross-platform visual and user experience design. In his time at Google, he has contributed to both web and mobile through Chrome, Chrome OS, Google Search App, Voice Search and more. Years ago, he made Quicksilver for mac.
e27b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Nicholas Jitkoff

e52d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Bob is the Director of Engineering for Internationalization at Google. He built and leads the globally distributed team that develops highly scalable technologies and infrastructure used throughout Google to deliver internationalized and localized products. Previously, at Netscape, he built the team that established much of the early work on internationalization for the web and browsers. Even earlier, he helped drive the initial Unix/POSIX internationalization specifications and standards via work with industry consortiums (/usr/grp, Uniforum, Unix International). Prior to Google, Bob worked for Netscape/AOL, Apple, MIPS, Nippon Unisoft and UniSoft. He holds a Bachelors in Computer Science from UC Berkeley.
e52d32e8-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Bob Jung

e56749ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan is…oh, I guess we're doing first-person? All right, here goes: I'm a software engineer on the Android SystemUI team, which I joined in 2009 before it really had a name. My fingerprints can be found on many of the pixels on your screen, including the status bar and main navigation buttons, app launcher, lock screen, and especially notifications. When I'm not writing software, I write more software, including the Markers drawing app for Android.
e56749ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Sandler

e6ca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Sriram's the Product Manager for Chrome Apps. He's excited about building a platform for web developers that combines the best of web and native. Before he joined the Chrome team, he was with the Google Cloud team making it easy to power mobile apps with Cloud backends.
e6ca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Sriram Saroop

e6f301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Rob Dodson is a developer advocate at Google where he focuses on Polymer and Web Components. In previous roles he’s helped craft design systems for massive enterprise companies,  user interfaces for console titles, and even built the occasional enchanted princess game. These days his mission is to fight for a better web and to help developers build great experiences.
e6f301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Rob Dodson

e7d41148-1afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Gabe is a product manager on the Android Platform team, working on the operating system itself, developer tools, and Google Play services. He's been around Android since the Gingerbread release, and previously worked on Google Docs and Google Apps.
e7d41148-1afb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Gabe Cohen

e864c044-d6cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Hayes Raffle leads the interaction research team conducting advanced development for Google Glass. He holds a Ph.D. and M.S. in Media Arts and Sciences from the MIT Media Lab, and a B.A. in fine art from Yale. Hayes specializes in creating interactive toys, systems and devices that engage people's touch to improve communication, education, and creative expression.
e864c044-d6cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Hayes Raffle

e88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Timothy is a Staff Developer Advocate at Google working on the Glass platform where he's helped launch the Google Mirror API and the Glass Development Kit.  He previously worked on Google+ where he helped launch multiple plugins and APIs including the +1 button.  He has taught broadcasting, theater, engineering, and various forms of new media at the University of California at Santa Cruz, the Academy of Art University, and the Digital Media Academy.  He has a B.S. in Computer Engineering, a Theater Arts graduate degree, and an M.F.A. in Digital Arts and New Media from U.C. Santa Cruz.  He loves solving problems and believes in improving life through science and art.
e88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Timothy Jordan

e9119eb7-d0da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Alley leads the User Experience team for Google Shopping, whose mission is to balance feature sets and business goals with a magical user experience and encourage solutions that represent the most user-centric intersection of content, business, technology, and design.
e9119eb7-d0da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Alley Rutzel

e995348a-33cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Andrew is a product manager for Android Auto, and has been on the team since the project's inception.  He is passionate about improving the experience for drivers in their car to be more connected, more safe, and more fun.  Andrew has a Bachelor of Science degree from Cornell University, and a law degree from Boston University.
e995348a-33cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Andy Brenner

e9e8ec20-5bf2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Megan is an entrepreneur, tech evangelist, engineer, catalyst and connector. At Google [x], Megan works on a range of projects including co-creating/hosting Solve For X to encourage and amplify technology-based moonshot thinking and collaboration. For nine years prior she led Google’s New Business Development team managing early-stage partnerships, pilot explorations, and technology licensing for Google’s global engineering and product teams. She led the acquisitions of Keyhole (Google Earth), Where2Tech (Google Maps) and Picasa, and also led the Google.org team transition to add more engineering with Google Crisis Response, Google for Nonprofits, and Earth Outreach. Prior to joining Google, Megan was CEO and earlier, COO of PlanetOut, the leading LGBT online community. Over the years, Megan has contributed to a wide range of engineering projects, including an award-winning bicycle lock, space station construction program, and solar cookstoves. She holds a bachelor's and master's degrees in mechanical engineering from MIT, where she now serves on the board. She completed her master's thesis work at the MIT Media Lab.
e9e8ec20-5bf2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Megan Smith

ebe920f8-94db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jaime Waydo works at Google[x] as a Systems Engineer on the self-driving car program. Before joining Google she was the Director of Engineering at Translucent Medical, where she helped transform the way physicians "see" inside patients during surgery.  Much of her earlier career was spent at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, CA, where highlights included leading the rover mobility mechanical team for the Mars Science Laboratory mission. Jaime earned her Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering from Montana State University in 2000. She also completed her Master's degree in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering at UCLA in 2006.
ebe920f8-94db-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jaime Waydo

ec3f8a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Lawrence has been working at Google for more than six years on mobile, Android, and Search.  He has more than fifteen years of experience in the mobile and wireless industries, holding a variety of product management, engineering, and marketing roles at both startups and established companies.  Lawrence has a Masters degree in Business Administration from the University of California at Berkeley Haas School of Business, and Masters and Bachelors degrees in Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
ec3f8a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Lawrence Chang

ed582d89-48e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Magnus Hyttsten works a Developer Advocate at Google. He is an uncompromising software technologist and product marketing fanatic that likes to work in fast paced environments. Prior to joining Google, he was working for a company in the Telecommunications’ Industry that he co-founded and worked as CTO for since 2000. He enjoys the datacenter, statically typed programming languages, evangelizing about technology, and doing things that have not been tried before. Right now, he is extremely passionate about Google Play services!
ed582d89-48e7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Magnus Hyttsten

ed6749ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Xavier Ducrohet is the Lead for the Android Developer Tools.
ed6749ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Xavier Ducrohet

eef301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Francesco Nerieri leads the global Mobile Cloud engineering team at Google. The team develops innovative solutions for the mobile messaging, synchronization, storage, provisioning, authentication and identity technologies.  With over 10 years of experience in the wireless communications and distributed systems fields, Francesco applies his expertise to direct the team's initiatives to advance mobile cloud technologies.
eef301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Francesco Nerieri

f08dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Tor Norbye is the tech lead for visual editors in Android Studio, and also spends a lot of time working on lint static analysis.
f08dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Tor Norbye

f184af29-46d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Nadya Direkova is a designer focused on speed of innovation and team-work that create simple, beautiful solutions for a global audience. She works as a Staff Designer and Design Evangelist at Google X, a new product lab at Google. To date, Nadya has run 80+ design sprints at Google, including projects for Google [X], Chrome and Ads & Commerce.
f184af29-46d2-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Nadya Direkova

f1945386-04d7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Paul is a Developer Advocate who specializes in performance, UX and design. He has a personal mission to help make the web frictionless and blazing fast.
f1945386-04d7-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Lewis

f1c3baaa-f7d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Viktor is a Senior Designer at Google working on cross product visual and interaction design with UXA. Previously Viktor led the visual re-design of Google Maps.
f1c3baaa-f7d6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Viktor Persson

f27b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: I am a UX and Motion Designer on Chrome. I also do Sound Design across Google, including Doodles! Before Chrome, I worked on the Self-Driving Car User Experience. I love to build interactive prototypes, teach kids coding and electronics, and practice Wing Chun kung fu.
f27b6c0c-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Manuel Clément

f28cc43b-35cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Devon has spent the last few years working on the Dart language, and more recently bootstrapping a Dart development environment written in Dart. His background includes language tooling and user interface design.
f28cc43b-35cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Devon Carew

f311440e-cdcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: John is the Engineering Manager for the Google Cast SDK and Cast services teams. At Google, he also managed the Google Play store team. Prior to Google, John was at Microsoft, working, among other things on IPTV services and TV apps. In his copious spare time, he is an avid gamer, comic book reader and family man.
f311440e-cdcb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: John Affaki

f35e8d9c-12da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Ray Kurzweil is one of the world’s leading inventors, thinkers, and futurists, with a thirty-year track record of accurate predictions. Called "the restless genius" by The Wall Street Journal and "the ultimate thinking machine" by Forbes magazine, Kurzweil was selected as one of the top entrepreneurs by Inc. magazine, which described him as the "rightful heir to Thomas Edison." PBS selected him as one of the "sixteen revolutionaries who made America."

Kurzweil was the principal inventor of the first CCD flat-bed scanner, the first omni-font optical character recognition, the first print-to-speech reading machine for the blind, the first text-to-speech synthesizer, the first music synthesizer capable of recreating the grand piano and other orchestral instruments, and the first commercially marketed large-vocabulary speech recognition. 

Among Kurzweil’s many honors, he is the recipient of the National Medal of Technology, was inducted into the National Inventors Hall of Fame, holds twenty honorary Doctorates, and honors from three U.S. presidents.

Ray has written five national best-selling books, including New York Times best sellers The Singularity Is Near (2005) and How To Create A Mind (2012). He is a Director of Engineering at Google heading up a team developing machine intelligence and natural language understanding.
f35e8d9c-12da-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Ray Kurzweil

f43f8a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jarek is a Knowledge Developer Advocate at Google and his focus is to help developers make their apps smarter. Prior to joining Google, Jarek was the Head of Engineering and Chief Product Architect at Hewlett-Packard’s Mobility Software and Solutions group managing a team of 100 engineers spread across three countries (US, UK and China). Before HP, Jarek worked on building complex communications systems at BEA Systems (WebLogic SIP Server and JSR-289), Mahi Networks, Alcatel and Celcore. Jarek has a BS in Computer Science with concentration on AI from The University of Memphis and Master's degree in Software Management from Carnegie Mellon University.
f43f8a18-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jarek Wilkiewicz

f58a1fd7-6ff2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Adam Metcalf is a Software Engineer at Google and has been working on the Google Play services team since May 2013. He has been using and building things for Android ever since he got his Android Dev Phone 1. Adam is originally from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada where he received his B.Sc. and M.Sc. from the University of Alberta.
f58a1fd7-6ff2-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Adam Metcalf

f6f301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Glenn is a software engineer in the Android media team, with a focus on low-level audio and performance. His background includes real-time operating systems and embedded applications, and he enjoys playing piano.
f6f301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Glenn Kasten

f709d15a-92d1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Complexity geek. Evangelist for the power of open…hardware should be more like software. Architect of factory of the future. Drone designer & rocket scientist. MIT. Caltech. Georgetown. Head of Google's Project Ara. Occasional pilot (yes, be very afraid).
f709d15a-92d1-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Eremenko

f787f5cc-35cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Paul Rohde is an engineer in Ads and an author on the AngularDart project.

Since the time I could walk I was always making something. I grew up cutting resistors in my dads basement, building robots out of legos, catapults in the garage and roller coasters out of k'nex. I am driven to to figure things out. I haven't climbed mount everest. I haven't been cliff diving or changed the world. But one day, I'm going to try.
f787f5cc-35cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Rohde

f88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Jamal Eason is the Product Manager for Android Studio & Android SDK Tools. He enjoys helping developers make awesome apps.
f88dae2a-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Jamal Eason

fa7b694b-93d0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Laurence Moroney is the author of dozens of books and hundreds of articles on programming for device and web. As a Developer Advocate for Google, he's focussed on cloud, and is super excited to see the congruence of cloud and mobile development made possible by technologies such as Android Wear. When not geeking out over technology, he's a novelist and screenwriter with three published sci-fi books, a TV pilot, and hopefully a movie on the way...
fa7b694b-93d0-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Laurence Moroney

fad12df6-19fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.bio: Miles Barr is the engineering lead for apps in the Google Play store.
fad12df6-19fb-e311-903f-00155d5066d7.name: Miles Barr

fb048c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Serge Kassardjian leads North America East business development for Android Play apps and games working with partners developing apps forAndroid. He previously worked on incubation businesses in Google’s GeoCommerce division, working on Payments and Offers and was a member of original Google Wallet launch team focused on merchant partnerships. He also was a Venture Capital Investor at Globespan Capital Partners and Corporate Development Director in Sony Music’s Global Digital Business. He received his MBA from Harvard and Bachelors and Masters in Engineering from Stanford.
fb048c1e-a6c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Serge Kassardjian

fd0e51c4-d4cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex Nicksay is a senior engineer at Google, currently leading the front-end performance team at YouTube.  Prior to focusing on making YouTube fast, Alex was the lead developer of the YouTube video page, and he has designed much of YouTube’s front-end architecture.
fd0e51c4-d4cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Nicksay

fd6749ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Kevin Moore is a Product Manager for the Dart language, libraries and tools. Before joining Google, Kevin was a software consultant specializing in Javascript, Ruby, and C#. He has been involved with the Dart project – writing, speaking, and contributing – for over two years.
fd6749ee-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Kevin Moore

fef301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Andy works in the Android platform media team, bringing more audio fun to your Android device.
fef301d6-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Andy Hung

ff47fbc9-33cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio: Reto Meier is the lead of the Scalable Developer Advocacy team of Google's Developer Relations organization, and author of the Professional Android Application Development series of books from Wrox.
ff47fbc9-33cb-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Reto Meier

ffca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.bio:
Sam Dutton is a Google Developer Advocate, specialising in media APIs and the multi-device web. 

Sam has designed and coded numerous websites as well as native desktop and mobile applications. He previously worked for BBC R&D, ITN, Decca Records and Picador Books, and maintains the site simpl.info, providing simplest possible examples of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
ffca32e2-a5c6-e311-b297-00155d5066d7.name: Sam Dutton

-wD-R3kNojY.desc: There are big opportunities for developers to reach huge numbers of users around the globe. But getting your apps globally ready can be challenging. Find out about what it takes. Learn from Google's experience, mistakes and foibles. Hear about tools and services that will make this easier.
-wD-R3kNojY.title: The world is your playground - get your app ready to play!

0oOwrBEeQss.desc: This is the second video in a 3-part series. It introduces the audiences to graph database processing with Cayley. The first video goes over selecting schemas and publishing data, extracting structured data and triplification. The second video covers loading and graph processing using Cayley. Together, the first and second videos cover ETL for linked data. The third video covers activating the knowledge graph with Actions. After watching the 3rd video the audiences will have solid foundation to embark upon I/O 2014 Actions/Answers codelabs.Build Your Own Knowledge Graph Part 2 of 3: Managing Graph Data With Cayley
0oOwrBEeQss.title: Build Your Own Knowledge Graph Part 2 of 3: Managing Graph Data With Cayley

0tH-KHvifMk.desc: An overview of the new features of WebView that shipped in the KitKat release of Android.
0tH-KHvifMk.title: What's new in WebView

1rUZmkifDPk.desc: Cloud-enable your app without writing a single line of networking code using the new Google Drive API for Android.  Learn how you can interact with the files and folders stored in a user's Drive from your app with seamless offline support.
1rUZmkifDPk.title: Drive Android API

2fZThdNbHcQ.desc: Bluetooth Low Energy is an incredibly exciting technology with the promise of unlocking a myriad of use cases. This session will focus on new Bluetooth Low Energy features, including improved scanning and newly added support for peripheral mode, in Android.
2fZThdNbHcQ.title: Bluetooth Low Energy

2toYLLcoY14.desc: Polymer is a library that uses the latest web technologies to let you create custom HTML elements. Build anything from a button to a complete application as an encapsulated, reusable element that works across desktop and mobile. Learn how to leverage web components, today!
2toYLLcoY14.title: Componentize the Web

4JcDYkgqksY.desc:
Wearable computing is here, and it offers a whole new set of challenges and opportunities for designers. Vastly different rules apply compared to phones and tablets. This video looks at what's unique about designing for wearable devices:

- UI principles of Android Wear
- The shift from app launching to contextual triggering
- Designing touch and voice UIs for small screens
- A look at common components and the Android Wear Design style guide

Presented by Emmet Connolly, Designer on Android Wear
4JcDYkgqksY.title: Designing for Android Wear

4uQMl7mFB6g.desc: Introducing ServiceWorker, the API that gives you full control over HTTP caching, request, and forms the basis for push messaging, alarms, geofencing and background sync.
4uQMl7mFB6g.title: The ServiceWorker: The network layer is yours to own

4y4-xn4Vi04.desc: Command-line tools are empowering: they deliver speed, control, traceability, scripting and automation capabilities to one's workflow. In this session we'll show you how to better control your cloud resources and developer workflow with a powerful, intuitive command-line interface for Google Cloud Platform.
4y4-xn4Vi04.title: Command Your Cloud with gCloud

5MnhFmFDLj8.desc: Interested in adding Google Maps to your mobile apps but needing inspiration? Did you know that you can now add Street View to your apps too? Come and see how incorporating maps into your app can delight your users! We'll show you some exciting uses of the Google Maps Mobile APIs and describe the functionality available in the APIs as we go.
5MnhFmFDLj8.title: Map Up your Apps!

5uF3925a974.desc: Cover technical and product challenges in building seamless interactive experience on mobile phones and tablets. Introduce the best practices followed by news team in overcoming browser challenges.
5uF3925a974.title: News mobile webapps: Build engaging and interactive UI for mobile web

675znN6tntw.desc: Processors constantly evolve new features which enable ever-faster processing while being much more efficient. Learn about those features and how to harness then on the Web using Portable Native Client.
675znN6tntw.title: PNaCl SIMD: Speed on the Web

6Dl6BdrA-sQ.desc: Ever wonder why digital audio has so many different sample rates and how they are handled? We’ll discuss where different sample rates arise, how a resampler converts between them, and the upcoming quality and performance improvements in Android’s resamplers.
6Dl6BdrA-sQ.title: Sample rates and resampling: Why can't we all just agree?

6E7-OAJFwMg.desc: How to internationalize and localize Mirror API Glassware. Covers Mirror APIs for fetching the user's locale, subscribing to updates to the locale, and how a typical Mirror API Glassware might localize its content.
6E7-OAJFwMg.title: Mirror API Glassware I18N and L10N

6ERgbIJ6pCM.desc: Attendees will learn how to design interfaces for wearable computers such as Google Glass through the application of user-centered design principles. Attendees will gain the knowledge needed to develop prototype applications for Glass and other wearable platforms.
6ERgbIJ6pCM.title: The Glass Class - designing wearable interfaces

6VjF638VObA.desc: ExoPlayer is a newly open sourced media player built on Android’s low level media APIs. It supports DASH and SmoothStreaming adaptive playback, and is used by Google’s YouTube and Play Movies applications. This talk discusses the design of ExoPlayer, its use of Android’s low level media APIs, and how you can use, extend and customize ExoPlayer in your own video applications.
6VjF638VObA.title: ExoPlayer: Adaptive video streaming on Android

8vJSCmIMIjI.desc: YouTube, despite being a video-sharing website, is one of the largest image hosting platforms on the internet with over a hundred billions images served daily. As part of the effort to make YouTube faster we explored a possibility of using WebP as an alternative thumbnail format and now we can share our experience and what we have learned during the ongoing project of a site-wide WebP adoption.
8vJSCmIMIjI.title: WebP at YouTube

Bzkk6Bb1BmE.desc: Signing in with Google has gotten easier and more powerful. Find out how to increase conversion during sign-in by asking users for exactly the permissions you need exactly when they want to use them. Also find out how to use Google sign-in for all users, not just users who have signed up for Google+.
Bzkk6Bb1BmE.title: Getting more users to sign in with Google

CrskWnKG8pk.desc: Learn how to use the high-level Android multimedia APIs to quickly add media to your application, and create a great multimedia experience. This session will cover video playback and recording, controlling subtitles, and taking advantage of external displays.
CrskWnKG8pk.title: Building impressive Android media expereinces

DWpBNm6lBU4.desc: Learn how to leverage the massive scale and performance of Google's global network infastructure.
DWpBNm6lBU4.title: Putting Google's Network to work for You

Eh2adsAyTKc.desc: Inspirational ways of using technology in the classroom. Examples of great apps, cool data-visualizations, etc. Developer perspective (guest speaker i.e. CEO Socrative - 10 min block) on the nuances of developing for EDU, tips & traps.
Eh2adsAyTKc.title: Succeeding in Education Technology

ExNxi_X4qug.desc: As the cost of DNA sequencing has dropped, the volume of data produced has risen into the petabytes. Google is working with the genomics community to define a standard API for working with big genomic data sets in the cloud. Building on Google Cloud Platform, we show how to store, process, explore and share genomic data using technologies like BigQuery, AppEngine MapReduce, R and more.
ExNxi_X4qug.title: Big genomic data on Google Cloud Platform

FbVWtYPpzIs.desc:
In this preview release we’ve added more features to the Android framework for Enterprise. In this video, we introduce a unified launcher for personal and work use and describe new concepts like ‘profile owner’ & ‘device owner’ to support both BYOD and Corporate owned devices.

We also give an overview of how we’ll be enhancing the Play Store to allow IT Admins to deploy apps to employees and describe the APIs that’ll be available for Enterprise Mobility Management.
FbVWtYPpzIs.title: Android Work

GR2s3L9_ziQ.desc: What are subscription products on Google Play? When should you use them? How can you use them? This presentation answers these three questions. It also covers upcoming functionality in the Developer Console and the Play APIs --  including setting up weekly and seasonal subscriptions, and enabling your app users to upgrade and downgrade from and to your different subscription products.
GR2s3L9_ziQ.title: Subscriptions Made Easy with Google Play

HAQ1UFu3b5M.desc: Android wear extends the Android platform to a new generation of wearable devices. The user experience is designed specifically for wearables. In this session you’ll see how to use the Android Wear SDK to build a connected cloud-powered application. Using Android Studio and it’s cloud extensions, you’ll see how to build an app that ‘listens’ for changes in stock prices, and notifies a wearable device. You’ll also see how to use voice controls on the device to trigger interactions with the app, such as buying or selling the stock after a notification. Call to action: Get the SDK and start building apps today!
HAQ1UFu3b5M.title: Building Cloud-powered wearable Apps

I0lt8Tphn2A.desc: Google has re-imagined how authentication works on mobile and the web. Maya Ben-Ari introduces you to the multiple ways you can establish that your mobile device is with you, and how to allow it to authenticate to your other devices. Our goal is to create a frictionless, invisible and most importantly secure authentication experience.
I0lt8Tphn2A.title: The next Generation of Authentication

IKhU180eJMo.desc: Learn about the vision and philosophy behind creating Google Play for Education, how it works, and the latest announcements.
IKhU180eJMo.title: Google Play for Education: What's new

IXDSPlVZRJE.desc: We've launched Chrome Apps to consumers. It's available on ChromeOS, Win, Mac and Linux! We can talk about new and exciting features since last year's Google IO: Managed In-App Payments, Unified GCM, enhanced Media Gallery API, the Mac App Launcher and more. We can showcase forward looking ideas such as ephemeral apps. We can also talk about developer adoption externally and within Google for firstparty apps.
IXDSPlVZRJE.title: Chrome Apps - State of the Union
