Ive8WaeldWA.desc: The Android platform provides a ton of great security tools, but some of those don't get the attention they deserve. This talk aims to close that gap by highlighting some of the best and least-known techniques for the development of both Android apps and the Android platform itself.
Ive8WaeldWA.title: Isolation for Android App Developers

KB94dIamAQc.desc: This is the third video in a 3-part series. It builds on the previous two videos to show the developers how to introduce Schema.org actions annotations into their knowledge graph.  The first video goes over selecting schemas and publishing data, extracting structured data and triplification. The second video covers loading and graph processing using Cayley. Together, the first and second videos cover ETL for linked data. The third video covers activating the knowledge graph with Actions. After watching the 3rd video the audiences will have solid foundation to embark upon I/O 2014 Actions/Answers codelabs.
KB94dIamAQc.title: Build a small Knowledge Graph part 3 of 3: Activating graph data with actions

KNKGM4ss5Sc.desc: Your car contains some serious technology. Learn about the Android Auto architecture, which enables you to control Android apps and services running on your phone through your car. In this talk, we'll highlight the key characteristics of the Android Auto protocol, which enables your Android phone to talk to compatible cars. We'll also take a look at some of the details of the Android Auto rendering subsystem, which uses Binders and the Android VirtualDisplay API to composite UI from multiple Android apps. Finally, we'll discuss how we're enhancing the Google Maps app by integrating with the Android Auto platform.
KNKGM4ss5Sc.title: Under the Hood of Android Auto

OzNuzBDEWzk.desc: Native Client applications can now be developed and debugging in the browser online or offline! Take a tour of our sandboxed tools including: curl, vim, python, gcc, gdb, git!
OzNuzBDEWzk.title: Building a NaCl app

PndUfIx6d3o.desc:
More than ever before, developing for global audience is a necessity than a luxury in today's world. Are you ready ... where to start? what does it entail? how do I do it? how to promote in local markets?

This talk will address above questions for android, chrome and web developers. In our journey of the where, what and how, we will take an in-depth look at various internationalization and localization tools & strategies available to you.
PndUfIx6d3o.title: The world is your playground - go global with Google

Q8jZHc0NS6A.desc: With the introduction of Custom Runtimes on App Engine, you can now use App Engine to run any language or serving stack that you want. This means that you can run Ruby on Rails, Node.js or your own favourite runtime and benefit from the all of the management features that App Engine provides. This video will show you how to get started with a building simple Node.js application using Custom Runtimes.
Q8jZHc0NS6A.title: Building node.js applications with App Engine and Custom Runtimes

QdINLG5QrJc.desc: Using the new network scheduling and task manager APIs to efficiently use network resources and conserve power.
QdINLG5QrJc.title: Using the Android Job Scheduler

RhiPJByIMrM.desc: The L Developer Preview adds a new way to improve navigation between Activities and Applications. With the Activity Transitions API, developers can easily add animations between Activities, including enter and exit animations as well as animations on shared elements. Take a look at how easy it is to add transitions between Activities.
RhiPJByIMrM.title: Activity Transitions

Rwc4fHUnGuU.desc: Tap Target Size, Touch Feedback, and Touch Events; everything you need to know to build touch support into your web app.
Rwc4fHUnGuU.title: Touch in a Web App? No Problem

TtHjo9xsWVc.desc: With Wallet Objects developers can create smart digital offers that users carry everywhere.  Learn how to add these offers to your app to incentivize your users to take action.
TtHjo9xsWVc.title: Offerize your App

UEfZ3aeCjoY.desc: We’ve analyzed tens of thousands of mobile websites to figure out what works and what doesn’t when it comes to performance and user experience on mobile devices. Here’s our list of best practices and dos and don’ts, with insight from engineers into the algorithms we use to determine what is a "good" mobile website.
UEfZ3aeCjoY.title: Mobile web lessons learned from analyzing websites at scale

UhdiQmS3kDs.desc: For ten years now, app developers have wanted to integrate Gmail features into their apps, and until now the only way to do so was to implement full IMAP.  Starting this week, the new Gmail API gives RESTful access to the user's Gmail threads, labels and messages, and does so with high performance, APIary level control and SLAs and with SDK level access for client side developers.  We'll show the API in action, highlight some 3party early adopters, and show how you can use it to power your apps.
UhdiQmS3kDs.title: The new Gmail API

UjLJoMWSXts.desc: In this session we'll give an overview of a new suite of App Indexing API's that will allow your Android app content to surface more in Google Search, autocompletions, and Google Now.  We'll also provide step-by-step guidelines for how to get started.
UjLJoMWSXts.title: App Indexing API's

W9pRpSW_KqA.desc: This is the first video in a 3-part series. In this video, Jarek Wilkiewicz introduces you to the reference architecture for support of Schema.org Actions (http://goo.gl/vw8rOJ) in the context of a specific use case (a music store). The video then then focuses on exposing entities using Schema.org markup with JSON-LD.
W9pRpSW_KqA.title: Build a small Knowledge Graph part 1 of 3: Creating and processing linked data

Wvx-BWKL0u4.desc: This session will demonstrate the music-making capabilities in the web platform via the Web Audio and Web MIDI APIs, across both mobile and desktop.
Wvx-BWKL0u4.title: Making Music with the Web Platform

Ww8ISWzZGRE.desc: Use the Dart VM's builtin Observatory tool to analyze and fix performances issues in Dart applications. Peer into a running VM and get real-time feedback on memory and CPU usage.
Ww8ISWzZGRE.title: Optimizing Dart Applications

WyFz2XJEFYM.desc: Android momentum, Google Play momentum, tips & tricks to succeed on Google Play. Revised version of go/playapps-deck (video only)
WyFz2XJEFYM.title: Introduction to Google Play

XXw8g-FbemI.desc:
What festivals are happening this summer near me? Where can I catch a jazz concert, see a comedy show, find a performance of MacBeth, or participate in a 5K race? Millions of users ask Google questions like these about upcoming events every day — but to answer well, Google needs *structured data* directly from the most authoritative websites for each event.

In this talk, we’ll describe how event organizers, performers, venues, ticketers, and website hosts can participate in Google’s new event search features. We’ll cover: the new JSON-LD markup format; new schema.org properties for specifying event information in detail; how events are linked to the Knowledge Graph; and what it takes to show your events in Search, Google Now, Maps, and more.
XXw8g-FbemI.title: How to Add Your Upcoming Events to The Knowledge Graph

ZNSLQlNSPu8.desc: Building a community helps improve app quality, increases engagement and grows your user base by leveraging fans. Learn how G+, beta/alpha testing, staged rollouts can help you foster a strong community to help meet your goals.
ZNSLQlNSPu8.title: Google Play: building your user community

ZaVkKagA_oA.desc:
Host card emulation is gaining steam in the Industry with Visa and Mastercard now backing the technology for Mobile payments. Since KitKat, when HCE was introduced with little fanfare, we've gotten inundated with questions and guidance from large firms across multiple industries. Many want to know what we are trying to to with NFC/HCE, how we're looking to position the technology, and how they can leverage it in their use cases. Interested parties range from building access, loyalty programs, payments, mass transit, airlines, banking, etc. 

This would be a great opportunity to highlight how we came about with our approach for HCE, as opposed to an embedded secure element approach, why we think its great and how people get get started making applications now that large players have thrown their hats into the ring.
ZaVkKagA_oA.title: NFC + HCE Your phone in an interactive world

_AZ6UcPz-_g.desc: Learn how to optimize your Android app so that teachers and students will love using it. The classroom is a unique environment that requires careful consideration from developers in order to build a successful app. An ideal app is simple, engaging, and can be integrated seamlessly into existing classroom tools. This video highlights what we’ve learned in our work with schools using tablets with Google Play for Education.
_AZ6UcPz-_g.title: Optimizing Apps for Education

_ComBx_QiYY.desc: Learn how to use the high-level Android multimedia APIs to quickly add media to your application, and create a great multimedia experience. This session will cover video playback and recording, controlling subtitles, and taking advantage of external displays.
_ComBx_QiYY.title: Building great Android media experiences

_IBiXfxhF-A.desc: Custom elements allow you to create your own encapsulated components on the web, however there are a number of questions that arise from this. How do you build elements that are accessible to everyone? Can they be navigated with a keyboard? How well do they work with screenreaders and ARIA? Learn how to create accessible elements that all your users can benefit from.
_IBiXfxhF-A.title: Polymer: making Web Components accessible

_M3z_vu45to.desc: Learn how to quickly and easily make your app collaborative with the Drive Realtime API.  Give your users the power of Google Docs-style realtime collaboration with no server, no sweat.
_M3z_vu45to.title: I hear you like realtime memes

_b0iU2LzlUo.desc: How to internationalize and localize GDK Glassware. Covers GDK/Android APIs and how the user's locale affects your app. Also covers typical internationalization pitfalls and how to avoid them.
_b0iU2LzlUo.title: GDK Glassware I18N and L10N

_oaEomdek-0.desc: As YouTube approaches its 9th birthday, we finally created a comprehensive styleguide. What took us so long? Join us as we talk about what it actually takes to define a brand book and styleguide for a product that is defined by the entire world of content and arguably one of the most complex user-interface problems out there. As YouTube is finally coming into its own as a streamlined user experience, it’s expressing its own unique brand voice while still managing to be a service for anyone, anywhere.
_oaEomdek-0.title: Creating a styleguide for…Everything!

aGvFbBt-LNA.desc: With Single App kiosk mode, developers can build powerful Kiosk apps that convert Chromeboxes into purpose built devices. The use cases are phenomenal from Digital Signage in Airports and Restaurants to ATM machines in Banks.
aGvFbBt-LNA.title: Unleash the power of Kiosk Apps

eORqFaf_QzM.desc: Google has 1M APIs and services. Every API is different! Learn how you can interact with Google services without writing code!
eORqFaf_QzM.title: Polymer: Interacting with Google Services using nothing but HTML

ep0_0W0qWsc.desc: Web Animations is a new animation model designed by multiple browser vendors and is now shipping in Blink. Chrome shipped CSS Animations and CSS Transitions running on top of Web Animations at the end of 2013. New Web Animation capabilities are now exposed in JS and give web developers powerful creative control of animations from JS but without jank. The Web Animations engine is one of the core features used by the Polymer project. This session explains the model, the new APIs, how to use them and shows real world examples of how to integrate them into your sites now.
ep0_0W0qWsc.title: Silky smooth Web Animations

g_zkOOWsmco.desc: Unify Cloud Messaging infrastructure to send messages to Android and Chrome apps. Demo of a cool game played across an Android tablet and Chromebook using a common backend which pushes messages to these devices
g_zkOOWsmco.title: Unifying Google Cloud Messaging across Android and Chrome

gfGuGdHdFJI.desc: Beta testing, crash reports, staged rollouts, ratings, replying to reviews. Providing a practical view of the developer console.
gfGuGdHdFJI.title: Building a quality app from start to finish

hnkTi6DfVKk.desc: GeoJSON has become the lingua franca of geographic data on the web. Let us show you how to turn GeoJSON into rich and engaging spatial visualiztions with a few lines of code, using the Google Maps Data Layer.
hnkTi6DfVKk.title: Maps Made Easier: GeoJSON in the Maps API

iYYHRwLqrKM.desc: How to build great forms that work beautiful on the multi-device web, content includes labeling, auto-complete, requestAutoComplete, validation, semantic input types, and best practices.
iYYHRwLqrKM.title: Fabulous Forms for the multi-device web

j5fYOYrsocs.desc:
Making the most of media APIs across platforms, with an emphasis on practical advice for web devs:
- responsive media
- coping with flakey connectivity
- accessibility and fallbacks
- formats and codecs
j5fYOYrsocs.title: Video on mobile

jrjfZ2ltvgE.desc: This session will focus on building and utilizing the full Google stack on iOS. We will walk through G+ sign in, Cloud Endpoints, Maps, YouTube, Play Games Services and more.
jrjfZ2ltvgE.title: Google developer tools and APIs for iOS

k9dtjsLi9Lw.desc: Even though YouTube operates at a scale of over a billion users per month, web performance testing follows the same core principles that you can apply to your own site. In this video, learn about how we measure the page load speed and how we instrument tests to make the experience even faster. We'll look at two front end performance testing methodologies: Real User Monitoring (RUM) with Client Side Instrumentation and synthetic testing with WebPagetest.
k9dtjsLi9Lw.title: Web Performance Testing at YouTube

kzuYtDy0ZHs.desc: Different mediums draw different types of users, offering game developers the opportunity to expand into new market verticals. Learn how getting your titles on TV can help you unlock new types of users.
kzuYtDy0ZHs.title: Getting your Game on the Big Screen

lZHwodEg0Xo.desc: When Google Play surfaces more relevant content to individual users, more developers benefit. Learn how Google is leveraging machine learning to get good at increasing conversion through Google Play search and discovery. (video only)
lZHwodEg0Xo.title: Maximizing discoverability on Google Play

lfTECEAH8o8.desc: An overview of building apps for Android TV with the new Leanback support library.
lfTECEAH8o8.title: Building Apps For Android TV

ljYeHwGgzQk.desc: Chrome's requestAutocomplete can help web and mobile web developers breeze through the process of creating a truly internationalized checkout experience for their users. Find out why it matters and see it in action.
ljYeHwGgzQk.title: Easy International Checkout with Chrome

midJ6b1LkA0.desc:
Vitess is a set of servers and tools primarily developed in Go. It's meant to facilitate scaling of MySQL databases for the web. It's currently used as a fundamental component of YouTube's MySQL infrastructure.

The talk will cover how Vitess solved YouTube's scalability problems, and tips and techniques used to scale using Go.
midJ6b1LkA0.title: Scaling with Go: YouTube's Vitess

n8E8Z5m8MwA.desc: Get a glimpse into what it's like designing for the enterprise, specifically for ads products at Google -- the lifeblood of businesses, and Google's primary revenue source.  Learn about the rewards, challenges, and risks involved with designing billion dollar pixels.
n8E8Z5m8MwA.title: Billion dollar pixels: Designing Advertising Products at Google

nU4lvgTrjFI.desc:
Chrome Apps can now run on both Android and iOS using a toolchain based on Apache Cordova. 
This provides developers a strong incentive to adopt web technology to build native-like apps targeting desktop as well as mobile platforms. 
We’ll be talking about the ease of development and the differentiating capabilities provided by the platform.
nU4lvgTrjFI.title: Chrome Apps on Android and iOS

naf_WbtFAlY.desc: Learn how to write beautiful apps outside the stream on Android Wear, with a focus on how users leave apps and how to design for a round screen.
naf_WbtFAlY.title: Fullscreen Apps for Android Wear

o-TAyIQBOuA.desc: Tips, tricks and practices to encode a video into WebM using VPx codecs for delivery across the web and on Android.
o-TAyIQBOuA.title: Demystifying encodes and decodes of WebM

o5cne6vK-eo.desc: This talk demonstrates some of the core experiences on Android Wear enabled by Google's first-party apps, and describes the changes we made to these apps to support a better wearable experience.
o5cne6vK-eo.title: How We Customized Google Apps for Android Wear

oK09n_PGhTo.desc: How to build responsive sites for the multi-device web. Topics include responsive, viewport, media queries, and some layout patterns. This content rolls up to the webshine project
oK09n_PGhTo.title: Building sites for the multi-device web

oPJrX6xm1A0.desc: Rendering content with alpha blending is a common practice for apps and games across web and mobile. But this visual technique does not come for free! In this talk, we will cover the difference between alpha blending/ alpha testing , how each one effects your content pipeline, and peel back the layers to see the performance differences in these techniques on various types of mobile hardware. Alpha isn't free, and as a developer, maximizing every pixel for performance can make a day and night difference in the look and feel of your app. #perfmatters
oPJrX6xm1A0.title: Don't Alpha that pixel!

obrHov9XfRk.desc: Google Maps is powered by a global database of places, from the Moscone Center in San Francisco to the Potala Palace in Tibet. We'll show you how to build these places into your apps, including reviews, ratings, photos, opening hours, and more.
obrHov9XfRk.title: Building location-based apps with the Places API

owhf42SZadk.desc: Learn how to use GCM User Notifications feature to enable your app to deliver notifications to multiple devices belonging to the same user and how to handle synced dismissals.
owhf42SZadk.title: Google Cloud Messaging

pNKnhBIVj4w.desc: PageSpeed Insights is a great way for developers to check how their site performs out in the wild, but how do you actually improve your score if it's not what you were expecting? Well in this session we will take a web application and use Grunt to create a build process that will help optimise our site to be faster and giving us a better workflow.
pNKnhBIVj4w.title: Getting Your PageSpeed Score Up

qdyNKNt2XLY.desc: This session will describe GCE's three block storage options, how they work, what they do for your app, how to choose between them, and how to tune for each. Learn the best practices for using block storage in Google's cloud to lower your costs and raise your performance.
qdyNKNt2XLY.title: Optimizing disk I/O in the cloud

rqXMwLbYEE4.desc: Case studies on recent WebP deployments (e.g. YouTube, display ads, and Google Web Search).
rqXMwLbYEE4.title: WebP

sIcieUqMml8.desc:
In which we discuss the embarrassing topic of floating-point audio,
and the benefits and criticisms that will come your way if you dare to try it.

16-bit PCM is one of the most common formats in digital audio.
But it’s getting old; do you remember CDs? Time to consider something else beyond integer and fixed-point.

Let your fellow programmers mock. You will rock.
sIcieUqMml8.title: Will it float? The glory and shame of floating-point audio

svfu9iQ8cyg.desc: Designing your UI so it works across multiple screen sizes is no longer a nice to have, it is *the* way to build for the web. Using Polymer, we'll cover how to create robust, responsive elements that work across all platforms.
svfu9iQ8cyg.title: Polymer: Creating responsive UIs

t90Vdn9r1Cg.desc: See what Google is doing to help you acquire, engage and retain gamers. Learn about the latest announcements including Google Play Games app update, Metagame, Snapshots, Quests.
t90Vdn9r1Cg.title: Google Play Games: What's New

tKoQatxG0_8.desc: I could give a talk on all the new features we added to the notifications API, including RemoteInput, pages, and bundles, and talk about ranking & notification bridging. Also would talk about the new DisplayIntent that uses ActivityView for custom layouts on a notification card on the wearable.
tKoQatxG0_8.title: New Notification Features for Android Wear

u63WowmIEao.desc: Simplify physical goods and services purchases on mobile devices with Google Instant Buy. In this video we'll cover why a simple payments are important and how you can add Instant Buy to your app.
u63WowmIEao.title: C.R.E.A.M - Cash rules everything around me

uTQ9KKyM9wo.desc:
This talk will explain how to write apps for Android Wear devices that need to support complex interactions with the user. We will describe the navigational concepts that Wear apps should support in order to integrate well with the device and provide guidance on designing the UI flow of your app. We will also introduce a new UI widget library that allows app authors to create experiences with the same polish and consistency as the system UI. Using this library, app authors will be able to create "stream-like" UIs that provide the same physics and transition animations as the built-in "home" stream or search results stream.

In detail: This talk is meant to be largely around how to use GridViewPager in order to create "stream-like" experiences in apps for Android Wear.
uTQ9KKyM9wo.title: Building Advanced UIs for Android Wear

vGotlqDeUGk.desc: From voice command menus to collecting open ended speech input, this codelab will teach you about all of the available voice APIs to create a compelling Glass application.
vGotlqDeUGk.title: Voice Driven GDK Glassware

vPfz2VwIryk.desc: How to integrate the PageSpeed Insights API into your workflow, understanding what it can do and how it can help you to ensure you've got a great mobile experience.
vPfz2VwIryk.title: Using the PageSpeed API

vpRsLPI400U.desc: For developers who want to use responsive images today, what can they do? We'll cover the current state like picture, img src, srcset, etc and include suggestions around art direction.
vpRsLPI400U.title: Responsive images today

vsmU09PoYy4.desc: So you need to build a responsive site. We'll look at how you set up your dev environment to best test across multiple devices and screen sizes.
vsmU09PoYy4.title: Testing multi-screen web pages

wkOUqsxwPyQ.desc: Open-source Big Data technologies have been growing more and more powerful, unlocking a wealth of new possibilities, and Google Cloud Platform is a perfect place to harness these tools with minimal friction. See how these popular open-source technologies interoperate with several different Google Cloud Platform products to let you mix and match these tools effortlessly toward your entrepreneurial goals.
wkOUqsxwPyQ.title: Open Source Data Analytics: Part of your Standard-Issue Cloud Toolkit

x5-ntYM_2UY.desc: Do you have a Holo-themed app that you want to update to use the new Material styling available in Android L? I'll show you the basics of how to do this, along with some pointers along the way.
x5-ntYM_2UY.title: From Holo to Material

xo_R40C7RTo.desc: We'll go over what has changed, improvements, what we are working on, and where we're headed next with the VP9 video codec.
xo_R40C7RTo.title: Update on WebM/VP9

yNe_HdayTtY.desc: YouTube videos are playing 40% faster than last year. We’re introducing SPF, a new HTML5 JS framework that now forms the foundation of YouTube navigation and enables our performance improvements. In this video, learn how we use SPF to implement dynamic page loading with persistent video players while maintaining fast server-side content rendering at scale.
yNe_HdayTtY.title: Faster navigation at YouTube with SPF

zVK6TKSx1lU.desc: Quickly finding your games' performance bottleneck is critical to address development issues before they become a problem. In this talk, we'll cover 4 simple steps to follow in order to determine what part of your CPU / GPU pipeline that your game is currently choking on. Find the problem, fix it quick, and be on your way. #perfmatters
zVK6TKSx1lU.title: Perf primer : CPU, GPU and your Android game

zlP0Nt58-Gk.desc: Google Cast is a technology for enabling exciting multi-screen experiences. In this session, we will provide guidelines and best practices for enabling Google Cast for your app. We will walk through live examples to demonstrate specific concepts.
zlP0Nt58-Gk.title: Designing for Google Cast

zvW4VO5a4w4.desc: Reach over five million businesses by publishing on the Google Apps Marketplace.
zvW4VO5a4w4.title: Google Apps Marketplace
